Reviews.Title: “Great price, excellent staff, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: westhoffen
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel for the price and location, just a few minutes from the Seine and all the tourist attractions. What makes it fabulous is the staff, they are so helpful and ready to hand out printed directions, watch your luggage or go that extra mile. We were very lucky as we arrived in Paris to sold out hotels, were suggested we go see Moun, the daytime concierge at this hotel. She is legendary for her helpfulness. She gave her last room, 44, which was very clean and comfortable, with a huge modern bathroom. We slept very well. The next morning at check-out we were stressed about where we'd sleep our second night in Paris and Moun told us to leave our luggage with her, go see the sites and come back, she'd sort it out. And she did, we came back to find a set of keys to a private condo we could rent for the night, just 3 doors down the street!I What a fabulous time we had. We can honestely say Moun and the staff at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne made our Paris trip great. You won't be disappointed booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Location and Price!”
Reviews.Author: ncbobby13
Reviews.Content: This hotel will give you the true Parisian neighborhood experience. Comfortable room, very clean, charming decor, and exceedingly helpful staff. We were able to check in early without asking and check out at our leisure. Every step of the way, a staff member was helpful with directions, suggestions, and friendly greetings. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Lourve, Opera House, or metro line going towards the Arc de Triomphe. You will not regret staying at this hotel! Not related to this hotel but a FYI for first time Paris visitors - meals and drinks are pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne”
Reviews.Author: Cork2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter. The reception staff were lovely and very helpful. The room was small but totally adequate for our needs. It had wifi and that suited us perfectly. The room was clean and comfortable. It's very near the metro. Plenty oriental restaurants in the street outside.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Good service”
Reviews.Author: Denise C
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with all services you need. Good bedroom and bathroom, nice breakfast, very good staff. Well located, near the main museums and close to the metro station Piramides. If you like oriental food, it's a paradise. Existem muitos restaurantes japoneses, chineses e cambojanos logo ao lado. But I think you will not forget the kindness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ismobile7
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for five nights for a part business/part vacation trip in early January 2012. As noted the rooms are small but they are totally comfortable and the bathrooms have a tub which is unusual by European standards. The staff, especially Moun, was really helpful in making reservations and giving directions and suggestions. They even brought up tea to the room one afternoon. The location is superb, in walking distance to the Opera, Louvre, and many shops and restaurants. We did not partake in the breakfast but I think it is reasonably priced for what they offer. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others who are looking for an affordable option in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great central Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Victor H
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant hotel! My wife and daughter stayed here from Dec 28, 2011 to Jan 1, 2012. It was everthing we needed. The location is convenient to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, shopping and Metro. There are many restaurants nearby. They serve breakfast which is fantastic and a great beginning because in Paris you will do much walking. The hotel is clean and quiet, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable. They can get dinner reservations at many small family owned restaurants. There's great shopping down many of the small side streets. The rooms are the size of an average bedroom plus a bathroom. I will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A small (and pricey) gem”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller123
Reviews.Content: This is a small place close to Opera and the Louvre. It is very clean and provides all you really need (although the room is, like most in Paris, tiny). The service was wonderful - the receptionist directed us to a small restaurant nearby that was truly exceptional - she also warned us of the usual tourist traps. The downside is the price - if we had paid 120 euros (including breakfast), I'd be more than happy, but 200 seems a very steep price to fork out for somewhere to lay your head down. Still, this is Paris, and finding a clean, quiet place to sleep here may just cost this much, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: dan2lan
Reviews.Content: The two main advantages of this hotel are the staf and the location. After a long day you feel that you are coming home. The rooms are clean and there's free Wifi. The breakfast is great but a little bit expensive and you can find cheaper just around the corner. There's two metro stations nearby and bus stations that will take you where ever you want. But most of the time you will walk because everything is in a walking distance. I defently recommand this hotel. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RichmondViaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location, 5 min walk to the Louvre, 2 blocks to a metro stop very friendly, helpful staff reasonable price for Paris surrounded by good Asian restaurants (for when you get sick of foie gras) clean comfortable bed bathroom en suite Cons: Small room; not terrible, but small In need of an update (for the price, not bad, though) Overpriced, underwhelming breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see all the sites of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Busyinnkeepers
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than we anticipated from the States, but the manager had a room ready for us, thankfully! The room was small, but comfortable. Flat screen TV, but we never even turned it on at all! Bath had a wonderful towel warmer, good hair dryer, and soft water with good pressure. The front desk persons were very helpful, giving us suggested routes for walking and seeing the sites of Paris. They also provided us with good maps. If you are looking for a good value in an expensive city, Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne is a good bet. The locations is superb. We would go back there again if we ever return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good”
Reviews.Author: marynga
Reviews.Content: Good location, next to transport facilities, metro,Louvre, nice city-walking opportunities. Good breakfast. Nice clean room. Helpfull front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique hotel in 1eme”
Reviews.Author: kmw819
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne is perfectly located in the 1st arrondissement within walking distance to several Paris attractions. The rooms are light and I was surprised at the amount of room we had considering Paris hotels are usually very small. Everyone at the front desk (Moun particularly) was very friendly and went out of their way to help us with maps and any questions. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a great value with charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: TheGumnuts
Reviews.Content: We've lived in Paris, and stayed in this hotel on a recent return visit to this lovely city. I've always found it difficult to find a nice little hotel in the city - it seems to be easy to find the bigger luxury hotels, but finding one of the many nice, but small and discreet hotels and at a reasonable price is less easy. So when we found this hotel and it turned out to be a lovely place, we were happy to have an address we could come back to. Our room was pretty small, but clean and well equipped. Breakfast is served downstairs in what would have been the cellars of this typically Parisian building. The staff was very helpful and friendly and made us feel at home. The location is very good, especially if you're planning to visit the Louvre, which is very close. There are plenty of nice restaurants in the area, and of course with the metro, nothing is far away in the city of lights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: JohncpSimon
Reviews.Content: I took a group of 18 people here in summer of 2008. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. They helped us book travel and restaurants among many other challenges. Hotel has excellent location within walking distance to many of the main sites. Have recommended it to many people since then and all were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: vinman9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, moderately priced, and the staff were very helpful. We had an easy walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and the Eiffel Tower. It is right near a metro station and bus lines, and plenty of good restaurants. I booked the hotel after reading trip advisor, and I'm glad that I did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Holidayseeker2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Louvre Sanit Anne is located about 5-7 minutes walk from the louvre. It's a small hotel in a very quiet set of streets. The lady on reception was very helpful and informative. The rooms are comfortable and about average size for Paris! Overall it was a perfect base and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good location”
Reviews.Author: terbang
Reviews.Content: We had the most expensive room (5th floor) with a small balcony. We could even see Sacré-Cœur from the balcony. Size of the room was OK, there was a mini bar and a not too noisy AC but WIFI didn't work on in our room - we had to go to the lobby. We didn't try the TV. Bath was OK as well, it had a small window. Breakfast was acceptable, but it was served in the basement in a windowless room where WIFI didn't work either. Staff was OK but not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location small rooms with clean baths”
Reviews.Author: AGrassini
Reviews.Content: Great convenient location, comfortable bed in tiny room with small bathroom--what you might expect for Paris and its 3 star rating. Pillows are in need of replacement and there are no extra ones in the room. The inroom safe did not work. The concierge tried to be helpful but she grossly miscalculated on her ability to call us a cab at 8.30am. Thus, we had to take the metro--most incovenient with luggage and not what we had wanted. Lots of Asian restaurants around this part of town. We have come to Paris three times over the last year, but we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully placed and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: bob63_10
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor hits again! We selected this hotel also based on good reviews, and had a great stay in Paris. The hotel is perfectly placed, walking distance from most of museums - five from Louvre - and to services, including metro and an affordable car park. The staff is very nice, always smiling and ready to offer support in finding a good place to eat. WIFI is ok, not really too speedy but they give you as many accesses as you need and you just log in once, that's it for the rest of your stay. The room was quite small, but clean and peaceful. And all this comes at a reasonable price, considering you are in the centre of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Mihael
Reviews.Content: Convenience: We stayed here with our two children and found it to be a convenient location, and in a central part of Paris. They don't offer quad rooms but we took two double rooms - one for the boys and one for the girls. Everything is walking distance from here include the Metro, Bus, and is located not far from the Opera and the Louvre. We arrived the evening before Bastille Day only just securing the last two rooms a week before. It proved to be one of the best choices on our holiday. Service: Moun and her team at the front desk are just superb and made everything so easy for us. She booked online tickets for Disneyland, river cruises and other tours - a very sweet lady. Rooms: Yes they are a little small and dated, but they are also very Parisian and value for money. The bathroom is functional and clean too. The breakfast is great - loved the coffee and Hot Chocolate as well as the croissants. Was a great place to meet with other travellers and share experiences. The hotel is located in a quiet part of Paris with a selection of Cafes and Bistros to dine at. All in all a very pleasant experience for a hotel of this rating.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: banana12London
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel - near the Bibliothèque Nationale - was perfect for me and the staff were friendly and welcoming. The room was clean and well soundproofed. But several little things let it down: thin towels, hot water not hot enough, no toiletries apart from soap. The decor could do with a facelift, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: RolandosCY
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever visit to Paris, and we wanted a nice, clean hotel with a central location to serve as our "exploration base". After checking on Tripadvisor this hotel seemed to fit the bill. Our satisfaction started the moment I called them to make a reservation, as the lady at the other end was extremely polite and helpful. I was even sent via email a complete guide on how to get to the hotel from CDG via all possible means! Location is indeed excellent: A short walk to the Louvre or Opera, 15 minutes to Concorde or Forum des Halles. Many metro stations nearby (2-5 minute walks) can get you everywhere in Paris in minutes! The room was on the small side (as expected), but was very fine for a couple which just needs to crash after a day exploring Paris. It was very clean and tidy. We were on the fourth floor (double room without balcony) and was very quiet, with a view of Sacre Coueur to the north (and the lines queing for the Japanese restaurants below!). The front desk stuff was simply AMAZING!!!!! Extremely helpful, they did all the reservations we needed for us, and were quick to offer suggestions, insights, maps, hints, everything. They certainly made a big difference to the quality of our stay. Moun and Etida, THANKS!!! We did try the breakfast, and for 12 euros per person it was definitely better than the breakfast offered by some nearby bistros. If you like to sleep late (as we did) there is a Paul's on Avenue de l' Opera two minutes away, but otherwise the hotel breakfast is very satisfactory. I especially liked the eggs cooked to order! As you can understand we were very satisfied with the hotel during our 7-day stay. The hotel is a real gem and highly recommended. We will be staying again at Louvre Sainte Anne during our next visit at Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but good location and price”
Reviews.Author: SJX
Reviews.Content: It's well priced for a hotel in the middle of Paris. And the rooms are small and outdated but serve their purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - felt at home”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Opera and several metro stations in a quiet street. The staff is amazing: Very friendly and incredible helpful. The rooms are small but nice and clean, and we felt right at home. Great hotel at a great location in the heart of Paris. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “The word is "cute"”
Reviews.Author: moowahaha
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a brilliant location. The rooms are small, which might be a problem if not travelling light but otherwise are clean and adequately equiped. I think we got a bit lucky as our room was round the side, so pretty quiet, but I can imagine the front rooms might be a bit louder. The staff are extremely helpful and the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is what makes this hotel special”
Reviews.Author: rascalWarrenTownship
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights sightseeing and visiting family. As is the case in Paris the room was not large but was quiet, very clean and comfortable. It had everything that we needed including air conditioning and a very nice bathroom. It is within walking distance to many attractions including the Louvre and the Opera. You can easily explore other sights and museum using the two metro stations that are very close. Their breakfast which was served in the nicely done basement was very good (the owner's son even cooked eggs to order). Unlike some other hotels, the croissants were fresh. If you want something smaller or merely a snack, there is a good Paul on the Av. de l'Opera. FYI, I had a sprained ankle and had no problem wearing sneakers. As many others have already said, what makes this hotel special is the fantastic helpful staff that will draw maps, give you easy written directions and recommendations. I will definitely stay at this hotel again, next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: teampamandpaul
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice small hotel with very helpful staff. The hand-drawn street map showing the locations of recommended restaurants nearby was particularly thoughtful. Staff also arranged our shuttle to the airport and made dinner reservations for us. Our room was small but very well organized, with excellent air conditioning and lovely decor. Breakfasts were plentiful, with omelets custom-made on request. The location is perfect for walking to the Louvre and other sites in the 1st arrondissement and handy to metro stops and RER connections for easy access to other parts of the city. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again during a future trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable hotel right near The Louvre”
Reviews.Author: LikestoTravel15
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at the Carrousel du Louvre, so I was looking for a safe, comfortable hotel with reasonable rates, within walking distance of The Louvre. The Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne definitely met my needs very well. There were seemingly endless choices of hotels in the area, but after reading positive reviews for this small hotel on Trip Advisor, I made a quick decision and chose this hotel. This cozy hotel is within a short walking distance of the Paris Metro, which could be an important factor for many tourists. It is also within easy walking distance (5-7 minutes from the Louvre and many other attractions). My room was very clean and tiny (as is the norm in Europe). The staff were friendly and helpful with directions and tips for getting around Paris (and to the airport). The hotel also has air conditioners, which is a nice feature attractive to many Americans, including myself. The weather was nice, though, and I only used the A/C for a few minutes each day, if at all. Breakfast is not included but was offered at 12 Euro daily. Consequently, the hotel rate is probably lower than if breakfast were included. This offers the traveler the option not to have to pay for something he/she does not need. For whatever it is worth, rue Sainte Anne has an enclave of about 20-25 Japanese restaurants, most of which had lines out the door at dinner time. Who knew the French loved Japanese food so much? Other cuisines are close by as well. In summary, I found this hotel to be clean, charming and cozy. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the rates were competitive and reasonable. The hotel is close to the Paris Metro and is within walking distance of many attractions, including The Louvre. I enjoyed my stay here, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value/service”
Reviews.Author: xzh150
Reviews.Content: Great location: one block away from Metro stop; 10 min walk to Louvre and Opera House Best staff: very friendly and helpful. When checking out on June 9th in the morning, I casually asked the lady attending the desk how to get to Orly Airport. When we came back a few hours later to collect our luggage, she handed me a "post-it" sticker with detailed instructions on how to get to the airport by public transit. I saved a bundle by following her instructions (all correct) instead of calling for a cab. Merci Beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Parisian hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: alfo_girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 5th floor for 5 nights and last night on the 4th floor so can comment on quite different rooms offered. Whilst the much smaller room was ok for one night it would have proved difficult for a longer stay for two people with large bags. The fifth floor room was spacious and featured a small balcony with views to Sacre Coeur. Just magic sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine, updating my journal and hearing the sounds of Paris. What really makes this hotel special is the attitude of all the staff to make your stay in Paris memorable. A hand drawn map with all the relevant information was invaluable when walking around the city. Recommendations to restaurants and tours were made no matter how busy reception was. One morning when we needed to make a particularly early start breakfast was prepared for us even though the kitchens were not yet open. I would have no hesitation to stay at the Louvre Sainte Anne again however I would want to stay in the larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: wwtraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Paris hotels are very expensive. This small clean hotel is well priced for its location so close to the Louvre and other tourist sites. Very near 3 metro stops. In the Japanese restaurant part of town. When you need a break from the cafes and brasseries, have a great bowl of noodles right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AmandaFoxy9
Reviews.Content: My family returned for the 3rd time to St Anne! We love this little piece of Parisian heaven and feel at home at each stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the location is PERFECT and the staff is the Very best!!!! Our 3 year old even tells people that she lives at St Anne. We adore this place and lol forward to many more visits!!! If you want to be a few minutes walk from the Louvre and Opera house, be cares for as if you are family than stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair access and review”
Reviews.Author: mishahu
Reviews.Content: What a charming friendly hotel. The staff were always very welcoming and helpful. I will definitely stay there again if I return to Paris. Wheelchair access had some limitations but I had a wonderful stay. The shower is roll-in but small. Only the front wheels of my commode went into the shower shell but that was enough to have a comfortable wash. There are handrails and everything was easy to reach. The main entrance has a step but there is another door with level access to/from the footpath. However the footpath is very narrow so you must take care when going out. This photo from another review shows it quite well http://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-s/01/8f/d4/2b/louvre-st-anne.jpg Rearranging the beds gave more open space in the room. See photos. The breakfast room is down stairs but you can have food brought to your room and there are many cafes and patisseries nearby. The hotel is in a great location with an easy wheel to the Louvre and Tuilleries.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location & lovely people!”
Reviews.Author: gjbholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our adult daughter in a triple room on the 5th floor for 3 nights. Was a bit dismayed to find out the the lifts only went to 4th floor as we had so much luggage, but the staff are so helpful that it isn't a problem.The room consisted of a queen & a single. As it is an "attic" type room the single is on a raised platform. Bit hard to describe, but it is not a problem for a young person. Might be a little awkward for older people though, so if you need to book a triple room its worth checking with them. Room had a tiny balcony where you can sit & enjoy the view of Sacre Coeur while you have a wine. Room was actually a good size for Paris and was impeccably clean. Had small bar fridge which is great to keep your drinks & a few picnic items in. Would have been good to have a small electric jug so we could make a tea/coffee, but that was only a minor thing. Good TV & air con. Comfortalble beds. The bathroom was modern & clean with bath/shower. Breakfast is in a lovely cellar & is really good. The location is amazing! Half way between the Louvre & the Opera. Close to all public transport & for first time tourists like us the Tourist Bus was a good way of getting our bearings, & only 2 blocks walk. If you get the Roissybus from the airport it drops you at the Opera & it is only a few block to the hotel. Make sure you have studied the map & you shouldn't have any problems. Best thing about this hotel though is the staff. They are its greatest asset, & seem to make a real effort with everyone. Would really recommend this place to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet place”
Reviews.Author: lipsky
Reviews.Content: A bit disappointed in the location/exterior...was expecting a larger nicer hotel...but everyone was delightful and helpful, especially the owner/manager (guessing she was) who helped us from start to finish--what a sweetheart! The room was very small (typical of France and Italy) but really appreciated the nice deep bathtub which I did use one night after much walking. The room was clean and well kept...altho i left with a rash, perhaps from the scratchy sheets. The bathroom was very nice, small but up to date. The breakfast was the best of all the places we stayed! Food in the neighborhood was more expensive and not very good...altho we did not eat at the neighborhood Japanese restaurants as we could not read the menus. Our last night we had dinner on the Champs-Ellysees at the L'Atelier etoile de Joel Robuchon (in the basement of Publicis Drugstore)-- it was superb (and of course quite expensive)!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel close to the the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: wrexondaf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pleasant and the hotel staff were friendly. Surrounded by Japanese restaurants and walking distance to the Louvre makes this a great location.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: notmydon
Reviews.Content: I picked this Hotel based upon the excellent reviews. My wife and I had a wonderful time here. The room was small but that was expected. The area was quite and the location is perfect for walking to the Louve and other tourist areas. I would also recommend just walking around the neighborhood. We found many interesting stores and the restaurants in the area all provide excellent meals. The staff (especially Moun) was all very helpful in giving directions and just helping to make sure our stay was pleasant. We would stay here again (the best recommendation you can give).

Reviews.Title: “central location,reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: flushing
Reviews.Content: stayed 11 nights,the room was quite nice with a wonderful balcony with a view of sacre coeur. the staff were very helpful with restaurant recommendations, tips on metro connections,etc. the two rooms on the 5th floor are larger than the other rooms and are worth spending the extra euros.

Reviews.Title: “A good clean central base”
Reviews.Author: nickelben
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here and would be happy to go back again. The room was kept very clean and the bathroom was immaculate. Top floor, 52. The staff were always polite and helpful and looked up answers to some of our obscure questions. Some street noise at night but it's a lively area in a friendly way.

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: ChrisS74
Reviews.Content: A small gem in the centre of Paris. Very clean, silent (although you are steps away from restaurants), very helpful and nice staff, great location and very good buffet breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: snowcat75
Reviews.Content: My second stay here, for good reason! Clean, pretty and quiet rooms, very helpful staff, especially for giving recommendations for sightseeing, etc..., delicious breakfast! Location is perfect for me...walking distance between the Louvre and L'Opera de Paris, where I catch the Roissybus to/from Charles de Gaulle airport. A very positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: coup
Reviews.Content: I originally booked this hotel for a vacation for my daughter and her boyfriend the week before Christmas. Unfortunately heavy snow in the UK and France made them cancel the trip so we re-booked for last week (4-7 Jan). The hotel was very helpful about the delay. Not only did they agree to do the new booking at the 2010 rate but they upgraded the room to a deluxe one with a balcony on the top floor. If I had not immediately clicked the "cancel" button on the agency resevation they would even have carried forward the first night deposit. (I'll try and claim that back if Eurostar ever send me a cancellation letter). Throughout the reception was always responsive to emails and phone calls. They tolerated my attemp to speak French then switched to flawless English the moment my capacity was exceeded. My daughter confirms everything that has been said about the perfect location. Even when they did get a taxi to the Eiffel tower it was only 10 euros. In the end a perfect romantic vacation (so I'm told!).

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Moun!”
Reviews.Author: danna_alexandra
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and Paris was our first stay. Our flight arrived around 6am local time and upon arrival to our hotel our room was not ready, as expected. We stored our bags in the lobby and went to explore. The hotel has an AMAZING location and you can walk to everything, although I would recommend taking the bus to the Eiffel Tower(there is a bus stop only a block or two from the hotel). After just a few minutes of walking we found ourselves at the Louvre, a few more minutes and we found ourselves at Saint Chapelle and Notre Dame. Upon our arrival back to the hotel our bags were already in our room. We stayed on the 3rd or 4th floor I believe, I can't quite remember, there was a little street noise but nothing too bad as the hotel is on a smaller side street. The room was tiny but not the smallest we stayed in, and very nicely decorated. Moun, the front desk attendant was FANTASTIC and very friendly. She recommended places to visit, routes to take, restaurants etc. She told us that she makes the best espresso and before our departure made us each a cup to try. She was everything we needed as newcomers to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “nice location , extreme friendly , central located”
Reviews.Author: MarcandMia
Reviews.Content: In between Opera and Louvre at walking distance from Champs Elysees and Quartier Latin , one minute from metrostation Pyramides ... so ideal location to start your discovery of Paris . Very friendly staff and a nice breakfast to start your day. Next timle in Paris we know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming affordable hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner51
Reviews.Content: Ok, so Paris hotel rooms are small, and this was no exception. But the location, cleanliness, and friendliness of the staff made this a very pleasant experience. We were able to walk to many of our attractions, and were given clear and precise instructions for taking the bus to others. I would (and likely very soon will) return and stay here again. Currently my favorite "boutique" hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the center of Paris -- clean, quiet, cozy, great staff”
Reviews.Author: jcatanz
Reviews.Content: This is the best place I've stayed in Paris. Centrally located. You can reach any point in Paris from here with ease. Literally steps to the Metro station (Pyramides). 5 minutes from the Louvre. Room is quite comfortable and is kept spotlessly clean. My double on the second floor, Room #21, looked out onto a very quiet street in back. Free wireless. Great breakfast in the morning: omelet made to order, croissant, bacon, potatoes, fruit compote, juice, granola, yogurt, cafe au lait. The staff are excellent. I left my camera battery, charger and adapter at the hotel, and they shipped it back to me within a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Paris-fantastic concierges.”
Reviews.Author: Neenerella
Reviews.Content: Close enough to Opera, Louvre, not too far from Notre Dame. Small romantically decorated place. Very helpful staff. Ironically located on a street full of sushi joints, but very close to authentic French cuisine, too.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: SandR14
Reviews.Content: We spent four fantastic days in Paris in early October and couldn't have wished for a better place to stay. The hotel was lovely and in a fantastic location in the 1st arrondissement. Very central and easy to get to lots of the sightseeing musts. However, it was the hotel staff who really made our stay special. From the minute we arrived we were warmly welcomed. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They went out of their way to help us with sightseeing options, best places to shop and eat and hints for getting around easily. Should we be fortunate enough to return to Paris we would automatically choose to stay here again. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed by Hotel Louvre Ste. Anne and Paris In General”
Reviews.Author: shelbymom
Reviews.Content: It was tough to decide which of the gazillion hotels to stay at in Paris. We chose this one based on the positive reviews on tripadvisor and the great rate we found on the hotel's website. Perfect choice for us. Close enough to walk to the Louvre, D'Orsay, Saint Chappelle, Notre Dame, etc. Nearby Metro stop for further afield sites like the Eiffel Tower. Yes, the rooms are small. No big surprise there. But we had friends staying at the Renaissance where the rooms cost three times as much and their room wasn't that much bigger. Bathrooms are also small, but up-to-date and clean. Front desk folks could not be nicer. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel. Starbucks is around the corner. Every cliche I had ever heard about Paris and the people who live there did not turn out to be accurate I'm delighted to say. All the waiters we encountered were pleasant. Taxi drivers were efficient. Shopkeepers were hospitable. No attempt was made to pick our pockets or steal my purse. My husband and I are both anxious to return. Oh, and I had been very concerned about what to wear there and that turned out to be the biggest non-issue of them all.

Reviews.Title: “Moun is better than any concierge I've encountered!”
Reviews.Author: calgontakemeaway7
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much Moun! You made our Paris experience wonderful! She helped us find great restaurants, travel arrangements, things to do...and even gave me a shopping bag to put my travel pillow/blanket in when I left because it was "more chic" than the plastic bag I was carrying as we left! She was personable and really seemed to be interested in our having a great time! The location was perfect to all the sites, yet offered enough of the quaint neighborhood experience that makes me love Paris! Our computer Wi Fi connection never worked..got error that Internet DNS server was unplugged. Night staff didn't know why on arrival and we didn't want to spend our vacation trying to gain access to the internet, but this was disappointing. Thanks to Moun, we still had a fabulous time. The first night, we were able to get into Le Manege De L'ecuyer, which was fabulous! The 2nd night we did not take Moun's advice and were sorry. Do not assume that Parisians are rude and unfriendly. You will be treated according to the way you act when you are in someone else's home! Walk in expecting to be catered to and you will walk out disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the single room”
Reviews.Author: Rachel V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Louvre St Anne for one night. The location is great and very central and a food heaven if you love Japanese food, as there is one Japanese restaurant next to each other. When I arrived, I was given a room on the ground floor next to the reception area, with a window giving directly onto the street. The room felt more like a box than a hotel room the standard offered was well below the €130 I paid for the room. Some 2 two stars hotel offer better value than this 3 star, I was quite disappointed.The stuff was very friendly tough.

Reviews.Title: “great bargain in the 1st..”
Reviews.Author: zottDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work trip. Free internet, best location. Walked everywhere. Felt very safe at night. The "aroma" of all the Japanese restaurants was a little interesting but it was easy to find our way home after walking all day. If you are looking for a reasonably priced room in the 1st this is it. The staff was great and the rooms were more than fine, all though a little small. The bed was comfy and having A/C in August was great. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good breakfast, great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFoolChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel in conveniently placed within walking distance of the Louvre and near tour offices. The staff really makes this hotel worth returning to. They go above and beyond to see that the guests are well taken care of. The breakfast is reasonably priced and you get eggs made to order. Cute hotel facility, but modest in size though quite comfortable. It is in a quiet setting and a safe neighborhood. I walked around by myself at all hours and never felt unsafe. They have an internet station for those without a computer. I would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Paul_McLa
Reviews.Content: This is a good medium range hotel which is in a good location for accessing all the places of interest on foot or via public transport. The rooms are little small, but clean, hey but you're out most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for tourist”
Reviews.Author: nangoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and found the location great for walking to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and we even walked to the Arc de Triomphe and the Eifel Tower from here. Metro just around the corner. Room small but clean and staff always friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast could be improved on, but location is everything in Paris! Price very good for Paris. Rooms also airconditioned, a necessity in the Parisian summer.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Molokov
Reviews.Content: I booked Louvre Sainte Anne based on tripadvisor reviews and its location, and I have to say I agree with previous reviewers. The location is brilliant, halfway between the Louvre and Opera, with many other lovely landmarks within walking distance - and the Metro for everything else. The staff supplied me with a map plus useful directions as to how to get to where I wanted to go. The room on the ground floor is fairly small but perfectly servicable and very neat. The air conditioner wasn't working but that didn't bother me - it was the staff who thought I would be too hot and supplied a pedestal fan, and even asked if I wanted to change rooms. Noise from the street can be distracting with the window open, but sleeping with earplugs was no problems. Plenty of Japanese restaurants in the area, but I went to try nearby French restaurants instead. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and friendly staff really make for a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alis0n2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasure to stay in. It has modest but quite comfortable rooms, and is very close to the main tourist attractions of central Paris. The real drawcard for travellers here though would have to be the absolutely lovely staff. They were kind, considerate and helpful at all times- just the thing for the weary traveller. As we travelled with a wheelchair and had several days where illness caused us some issues, we cannot recommend them highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: dslye3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four days during our honeymoon. This is a smaller boutique hotel with wonderful friendly staff. The rooms are somewhat small but that is Paris and ours was very clean and very comfortable. The heated towel rack in the bathroom was a nice touch. On our first night Moun brought us some champagne for us because it was our honeymoon. She was just a delight. She helped us with some great restaurant recommendations and reservations. The hotel is in an excellent location. The Louvre, Tuileries, the Opera House, and the Metro are all just a few minutes walk away. We did the tourist hop on hop off bus which had a stop near the hotel which was fun. Breakfast was included in our package and it was very nice. Fresh fruit, croissants, eggs cooked to order, etc. Our stay here was wonderful and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZUnicorn
Reviews.Content: We were most impressed with this hotel. It is so well situated that we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to see in Paris. The staff were very helpful. The room was small, but clean. It is in a quiet street, and double glazing kept noise levels low. There are plenty of nice, reasonably priced brasseries and bistros nearby. There are even a couple of laundrettes within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: tazdev71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights May 22-24, 2010. The hotel is a boutique hotel, which is what we wanted. The location is excellent. 10 minute walk to the Louvre or Opera. 2 blocks to the Pyramides Metro station. Our room was small, by US standards, but very well maintained. Exceptionally clean. Our bathroom was nice too. We had a balcony with a great view of the quaint street we were on, as well as Montmarte. We did not get the breakfast, but should have. As we paid 30 euros for 2 for breakfast at a sidewalk cafe. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was free wi-fi in the hotel, but we didn't bring our laptops. So we did have to purchase an internet card for 60 minutes of service and use the computer in the closet in the lobby. Its sponsored by a local vendor; not much we could do about that. If you like Vietnamese Pho, try the Cambodian restaurant directly across the street. Great pho.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: DennyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Excellent, small hotel, three blocks from Louvre, right off Avenue de l'Opera. Extremely pleasant, helpful reception. Since my room was ready when I arrived at around 11:30 a.m., I didn't have to wait till check in time to get settled and have a much-needed nap. Room was small but comfortable. Hotel is on a quiet street, so noise was minimal. Only complaint: the shower -- a thin trickle of water that took a long time to warm up, and then kept warming till it became scalding. Very difficult to adjust water temp. But, for a couple of days -- and for the price -- this was tolerable. Otherwise, I'd highly recommend this hotel. Optional breakfast is a bit expenive (especially considering many alternatives in the neighborhood).

Reviews.Title: “Loved that we could walk to everything we wanted to see in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: jrglwcz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel the night before my college age son and I arrived, they were really nice on the phone, held our room without a credit card. We arrived very early in the morning and knew we wouldn't be able to get into our room for awhile. They held our luggage while we got some breakfast and walked over to the Eiffel Tower. It was a nice walk along the Seine and when we got back around noon or so, our room was ready. It wasn't a large room but it was perfect- the air conditioning was awesome- the room and bathroom were very clean. The room was facing a busy street with a few popular Japanese restaurants on it- but we had no issues whatsoever with noise- didn't hear anything. Beds were great- nice and comfortable. We slept late in the mornings and never heard any banging around outside our door. The two ladies and one gentleman who work the front desk were all really nice and helpful and friendly, very willing to help. Moun was wonderful in her recommendation of a restaurant with the best view of the Eiffel Tower on our last night there- she was wonderful drawing maps for us and helping us get around. As I said earlier, we walked to everything from there and loved it all. We would recommend this hotel for their friendliness, nice rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, very helpful staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: csn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne and it is very much as all the positive reviews have stated. Edyta and Moun are both fantastic, friendly and helpful! The Roissy bus to/from CDG is a 10 minute walk from the hotel and the Louvre is about 10 minutes away. The Pyramides metro station is just a few minutes away, just as a couple of the bus lines, 21 and 27. http://www.ratp.info/orienter/cv/carteidf.php?lang=uk http://www.ratp.info/orienter/cv/cartebus.php?lang=uk

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: nsung
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris several times before and have stayed at more expensive hotels in the 1st arr. but was never completely happy with them. This hotel was fantastic all around. The room was very clean and comfortable - no rust stains in the bathroom or discolored tile grout, clean sheets and towels, comfortable beds, plenty of space for your suitcase, and even a detachable handheld shower head. The service was great also – Moun was very personable, and Edyta was very helpful when we ended up having to leave Paris early due to a family emergency – thank you so much. The area feels safe at night since there are local restaurants open late, but the street noise in the room was minimal. Location was excellent for easy walking to the Louvre and Ile de la Cite, and the Pyramides metro stop nearby has 2 metro lines which makes it even more convenient. I will definitely stay here again, which is the first time I’ve been able to say that about a hotel in Paris. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne”
Reviews.Author: INFO260669
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located, very close to all main attractions of Paris. The staff is very friendly, helpful, and we felt their caring every day. Rooms are cozy and clean. Hot breakfast and free wi-fi Internet connection in the rooms are undoubtedly good advantages of the hotel. I will return to this hotel during my next visit to Paris with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely book this hotel on next trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: PeterLondonW9
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading others reviews on Tripadvisor for a short beak in Paris. The hotel is in a fantastic central location within walking distance of the Opera or Louvre. Transport to Metro Pyramides is just a couple of minutes walk. On arrival we were immediately impressed with the friendly receptionist who throughout our stay was always trying to go out of her way to help. Rooms were as small as always expected in Paris but well decorated and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Trip485
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Sainte Anne for a week and found it was in an ideal location. It was a quick walk to Metro Pyramides and the Louvre and an easy walk to Galeries Lafayette. The staff were ever so helpful and kind and greeted us with a smile and a chat. The room was small (we didn't need anything bigger as we were out sightseeing 12 hours a day!) but clean and the private bath was equally as clean and updated. We especially liked the towel warmers! Merci Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne! A bientot!

Reviews.Title: “Our Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: KSPortlandOR
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel right smack in the middle of Paris (quite literally)! You are a short (3min?) walk to the Pyramid metro stop and a 8min walk to the Opera house. The hotel itself is very clean, tastefully decorated (but don't expect modern or trendy), has nice bed/bathroom, flat screen tv and was just perfect for the two of us. There is not a lot of room, but that is expected and we didn't spend much time in our room anyway. The front desk staff is WONDERFUL. SO friendly, willing to help and all speak in English (if needed). They would always offer to call to confirm reservations and for a cab.They let us barrow an electrical converter, which was nice. The hotel wireless internet ran fast and we never had a problem. The hotel was quiet at night and the other guests were friendly. We did not partake in the breakfast at the hotel, so we do not have any review on that. A couple tips: -If you need a 'firm' pillow, either ask for two or bring your own. The pillows are very soft (which my husband liked, I just used two!) -As far as amenities in the bathroom, there is only a 'shampoo/body wash' gel, which is nice for washing your body, but if you are looking for a little 'more' in haircare, bring your own conditioner/shampoo. -There was no clock in our bedroom, so either bring your own clock or just set up wakeup calls with the front desk ***You MUST try these restaurants which are a short walk from the hotel... 1.) Les Fines Gueules | 1er, 43 rue Croix-des-Petits-Champs [--] It is a nice intimate wine bar that has fantastic wine, delicious food and wonderful service, its on the 'trendy' side of things...a hip young crowd of all ages 2.) Le Rubis | 1er, 10 rue du Marche St-Honore [--] This is a 'gem' of a wine bar with true french personality and run by the same person for the last 25years. At night they have inexpensive wine, cheese and meat plates that are just right for a late night snack. The place is not touristy at all and had people from all generations enjoying the evening. I would not hesitate one bit to recommend this hotel to family, friends, people I meet on the street etc. It is in the perfect location, comfortable and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel with great staff & good location”
Reviews.Author: ssh217
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed here for one night as we transfered over from another hotel so we could be walking distance to Gare du Nord to catch the Eurostar the next morning. We walked over from our other hotel by the Eiffel Tower and it wasn't too difficult to find on foot. The hotel is located in a Japanese district and the one sushi place across the street was very popular. The front desk staff was very friendly and eager to offer suggestions and maps. Our room wasn't quite ready but we were told it would be in 15 minutes and 15 minutes later it was. It was a very quaint room with chenile wallpaper. The bathroom was small but very clean. There was only a small barrier for the shower so the water sprayed all over the floor and toilet. There was a towel warmer in the bathroom but ours didn't work. The bed was a bit too stiff for me. The hotel was very convenient to the opera house, Louvre, and it was a 30 minute walk Gare du Nord. Unfortunately, we left too early to try out breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great service”
Reviews.Author: Jens_A_Skumfjell
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Louvre Saint Anne last weekend. The hotel is small and centrally situated in short walking distance from the Louvre, in a nice and quiet street that turned out to be the "Japanese district" of Paris. It is easier to get a bottle of sake in the most nearby shops than a bottle of French wine. Back to the hotel. The first thing to point out is that the service is exceptional. My girlfriend and I asked if the receptionist knew any good places to eat in Montmartre, which is fairly long distance from the hotel, and we also asked if she could make us a reservation for at nine. A bit later the receptionist had found and called two alternative restaurants, and then she made the booking for us at Chamarré (excellent place, you should try it). Moreover, after somewhat of a journey in the nearby area, we finally brought home a bottle of champagne to celebrate with in our room before dinner. At this point, the same friendly receptionist was most helpful with getting us correct glasses and a bucket with ice for the bottle. Most satisfying! The rom: Nice, clean, tidy and with a charming French style. However, our room was on the small side. There was not much floor space other than for the bed. However, we had nothing to compare with, this being the first time in Paris. After spending a weekend in this city and having to squeeze in to be seated at most restaurant tables, the conclusion was that space is a luxury in centre of Paris. All in all, this hotel is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: heund
Reviews.Content: thank you again, Trip Advisor, for a great recomendation. This is a small, no frills, hotel near the Louvre and the Opera, about a block from the Pyramids Metro - easy walking to many sites, on a small street full of Japanese restaurants. Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we chose room 51 (off season 175 Euros/nite - rooms without view much less) which was considered a triple with a very small balcony with a great view of Sacre Coeur (room 52 slightly smaller, but also has view) - elevator goes to 4th fl, then walk up a short flight to 5th. Room exceptionally quiet with doors closed and immaculate. Best feature of hotel, aside from location, was staff, especially at front desk - we've travelled all over the world and can't recall a more friendly, helpful front desk staff, even helpful before our arrival with suggestions via internet. Louvre St Anne does offerr a good breakfast, but at addl cost of 12 E - we chose to go around corner to excellent patisserie for coffee and pastry for less. Small fridge in room, and water heater free on request for tea, etc. No pool or business center, but believe lobby is wi-fi, tho we don't use computer on vacation. This is not the Ritz, but the fiendliness and helpfulness of staff as well as our view made this a perfect hotel for us. We spent 4 nights in Feb 2010 for our anniversary here and could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay and great service”
Reviews.Author: anirban4u
Reviews.Content: This is easily one of the best hotels I have stayed in terms of warmth, hospitality and location. We had an infant with us and right from sterilising his bottle to providing warm water everyday all the staff were helpful. Finally towards the end of our trip we landed in trouble (thanks to Eurostar and their legendary service) as all trains got cancelled. Again the hotel staff really helped us by extending our stay at the same rate and finding alternate routes for us to find our way back home. We really enjoyed our stay over there. P.S: There is a cafe nearby (can't remember the name) and you get excellent home made cakes there. Also the whole street is flooded with Japanese restaurants and you've got to try them at least once

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommended”
Reviews.Author: moorboy_10
Reviews.Content: Great location for a visitor to Paris, the hotel is very clean, the rooms likewise, the staff are some of the friendliest hotel staff ever encountered, very informative and extremely helpful, could not recommend highly enough as our experience was excellent

Reviews.Title: “The perfect little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: person50
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne every time I have visited Paris for 4 straight years. It is a fantasic gem. The location is great and it is very comfortable. However, that thing that sets it apart is the service. For a non-French speaking person, the staff at the Hotel take VERY good care of you. From local restaurant suggestions to talking to a taxing that doesn't speak English in another part of the city, you always feel comfortable that they are going to take care of you and make your visit to Paris a wonderful experience. I HIGHLY recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & warm reception”
Reviews.Author: MDFinMIA
Reviews.Content: Happy to report that this little 3-star discovery is pretty much as others have written. Hidden away in Japan town, in a super location half way along the Avenue de l'Opera between the Garnier and the Louvre, it's a terrific bargain for the 1st. Rooms are small, a bit worn, but certainly clean and well serviced. Reception staff (especially Moun) are amazing, eager to please and assist with any detail (especially thank you for your restaurant recommendation of Le Cordonierre). We'll be back on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “very helpful”
Reviews.Author: lindsayjr
Reviews.Content: Only planned 2 nights in Paris, and hotel in great position, very warm and comfortable bed. Quiet too, despite being on street of buses and restaurants. However, stuck for extra 2 nights 'cos of Eurostar shambles. Edith, on reception, tried many times to get us flights, find out what was happening etc, and gave us full use of the hotel laptop. She kept our room for us as we checked out 3 times and then turned up again! Really can't recommend hotel enough, although as noted before, rooms are very small, but normally that wouldn't matter at all. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Job”
Reviews.Author: StagandHen
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, very helpful staff and a fantastic location. Stayed for only two nights. Whilst the hotel and room was small it was very clean, and good value. A typical city hotel! Location was great, 10 euro taxi from the Eurostar, as soon as you walk out of the door there are restaurants everywhere and yet a 10 min walk to some wonderful attractions! Would have no hesitation in using this hotel on our next visit..... WELL DONE!!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: AmandaFoxy9
Reviews.Content: When we decided to return to Paris we knew that we would also return to Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne. We feel like we are at home when we stay here and knew that our vacation would not be complete without the crew at Sainte Anne. This trip was special because we were returning with our daughter and with my mother. Moun (as well as the rest of the staff) could not have been more accomodating and welcoming. Our rooms were clean and cozy and the breakfast is out of this world!!!! Let me also state that my Mom had a wheelchair and we had a bulky stroller and each time we came and went from the hotel they hopped up to assist us in anyway possible. They could not have been any sweeter with our daughter who also fell in love with the staff. We also ran into an issue renting our car and Moun spent HOURS speaking with dozens of people trying to "fix" our problem. We feel very blessed to have found Sainte Anne and will never stay anywhere else while in Paris!!! We could not speak highly enough of this hotel. The rooms are just right (and very clean), the people are fantastic, the location is PERFECT and if you get one of the two larger rooms on the top floors the view on the balcony will take your breath away!!!! We love Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne and know that you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a super location.”
Reviews.Author: Mogssy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an excellent location. The staff are very friendly and helpful and will help you with directions to places of interest. The Hotel is quiet and relaxing, you can have breakfast in the small dining room and be sure to ask for the omelette. Near the Louvre and central to Paris. Have stayed twice now at this Hotel and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “a great location and quiet, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: balzac09
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. Don't bother eating there, the breakfast was just o.k. There are many great places to eat close by. The location is close to the metro and buses, and a Starbucks is a few hundred feet away when you need a large american style coffee to get going before sightseeing. The tiny cups they serve in the cafes just don't help with the jet-lag. If you like Japaneses food there are several restaurants right outside the front door. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ab Fab”
Reviews.Author: AreWeThereYet60
Reviews.Content: Only had a short stay here in Paris but it was all we expected. Did a lot of research and this Hotel was at the top of the list. Certainly is in a fabulous location, Metro Pyramides station is nearby, easy enough to walk to the Louvre etc. The room we had was on the second floor and on the small side as expected, but had absolutely everything in it we needed and very clean with a modern bathroom. Paris can be a little on the noisy side but double glazed windows took care of that. Best of all were the staff who always had a welcoming smile and were extremely friendly and helpful. Highly recommended for the price.

Reviews.Title: “very good spot”
Reviews.Author: selbbub
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel very good, in a convenient location, handy for the tube and sights. we had the top floor with a small balcony with views onto the street and sacre coeur in the distance. Absolutely wonderful to wake up on a morning and see that. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. There are many oriental restaurants locally with good food. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we felt that 12 euros each was a tad expensive, but that apart considering the costs of parisienne hotels it was fair value. We would stay there agian and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, great location, wheelchair friendly, value! We will be back for all future Paris stays!”
Reviews.Author: Bookman54
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two reasons: the very positive TripAdvisor comments and the photo they emailed of the bathroom of the Accessible room. The location near the Louvre and Opera was outstanding: an easy walk to all our Paris touring. The hotel staff was extraordinary: very helpful and excellent personalized suggestions. The major down-side of the hotel's location is that the neighborhood, with many restaurants and tourists, is noisy at night. Our modestly furnished room was small but met our needs. The roll-in wheelchair shower (one of the few in Paris) was a big plus - although its floor drain tray involved a small drop down and was quite cramped when using the shower chair. The sink height and mirror angles made them difficult but usable for wheelchair users. Our five day stay went quickly and we look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: flutterbabe57
Reviews.Content: Clean Room with a large Bathroom for Paris, which even included tub. Very helpful and nice staff. Also, free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wheelchair Accessible room in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Marg54_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 5 nights at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne. I am in a wheelchair and needed a room with an accessible bathroom and a shower, something quite rare in Paris. We were not disappointed. The room was perfect and the staff were amazing. Nothing was too much trouble and all of them were always so friendly. The location is perfect. A short stroll to the Louvre and many other attractions. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: spideylookalike
Reviews.Content: If you have never stayed in a hotel in Paris before, you must adjust your expectations when comparing Paris hotels to most hotels in The States, etc. The rooms are very small. Large hotel rooms are typically very expensive. I chose Louvre Sainte Anne based on the reviews from Tripadvisor. I'm not dissappointed with my selection. The location is ideal... on a quieter street, close to restaurants, shopping, major tourist attractions and of course, the Metro (Pyramides station). My transatlantic flight arrived quite early and I reached the hotel at 8:30AM. "Moon" at the front desk was expecting me and said that they were completely booked the night before and I couldn't check in immediately because no rooms had yet been cleaned. She invited me to have breakfast and within 30 minutes, my room was ready. For Paris hotel standards, everything was excellent. The bed is comfortable, somewhere in size between a twin and queen. My desk is more of a makeup table, but my laptop fits perfectly and the wireless signal is free and strong. The flat-screen TV gets about 20 channels and CNN in English. The view from my room is of the Japanese restaurant across the street. The hotel is in the Japanese section of the city, but one block over is all the pharmacie's, brasseries, etc. The bathroom is clean and functional with modern faucets and hardware. The shower is tiny and I still have yet to figure out how the French take showers in stalls with no glass or curtain without getting the floor wet. The towels are clean, but tiny and rough. They provided me with one bath mat, a bath towel and a handtowel. They don't give little bottles of soap or shampoo, just some squeeze soap/shampoo attached to the wall in the shower and one next to the sink. I actually ran to the market to purchase my own bar of soap... bought the same one I use at home to remind me of home. If you want a good location and want a good value, this hotel will not dissappoint. If you have tons of bags and need space to spread out, consider a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hospitability and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sistuhij
Reviews.Content: September 30, 2009, Columbia, MD ~ Ilean & Jenine My daughter and I flew to for my 46th birthday, when we arrived early then the expected time of check at the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne ... ... I found Mona as beautiful in person and the rest of the staff was truly outstanding! She allowed us to leave our bags while the room was being cleaned early for us to check in early. She was so kind and so helpful which my Birthday differently one to remember in Paris! And whatever we needed to see we jumped on the Hop-on-Hop off bus tour which too us to most of the main attractions, even the bus was within walking distance to the Louvre and and then some.. delightful hospitability! I will differently refer this hotel to my friends and family and I’m especially looking forward to coming back with my hubby!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kuchinglover
Reviews.Content: A good hotel to recommend in Paris for less than EUR150 /night. This is a 3-star hotel. It's walking distance 5min to Pyramides Metro Station, and probably 7-9min to Palais Royal Musee du Lourve station. A few steps to the Louvre museum, the Tuileries Garden and the Opera house (walking 5-10min). The room is small but very comfortable with hairdryer, mini fridge, wardrobe etc. The staffs are friendly and very helpful in many ways especially Miss Mounira at the reception. The hotel is near a long stretch of Japanese/Korean food chains where some food might taste like Chinese style cooking rather than authentic Japanese. There are 2 mini marts nearby to get your bottled water or daily stuffs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: grichards
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this Hotel. Arrived in mid morning after overnight flight and we were greeted warmly and were able to get in our room immediately. The room is small but adequate as others have related. It was quiet and we had no complaints. The staff is very friendly and very helpful in advising about area restaurants and in directing one to whatever sight seeing adventure one would chose. They speak excellent English. The metro stop is close and bus stops are very near. When we came in late evening, the front door was locked and we felt very secure. The night desk person would let us in. We did not eat breakfast at the restaurant, chosing to go to the neighborhood coffee shops. The location was such that we were able to walk to most of the sites one usually wants to see. When we needed a taxi to move to another hotel (we joined a river cruise group) they called and arranged for transportation. Really, have no negatives to relate. The rooms are small and not fancy but that is what we expected and we would certainly stay again. Previous postings have been accurate in our view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: EileenMChicago
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located just two blocks from the metro and within walking distance of the Louvre, Marais, Opera, etc. Nice basic rooms, cozy breakfast room with individually made omelettes as well as nice selection of pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit. Extremely helpful staff, both prior to our trip and during.

Reviews.Title: “The women at reception should be rated 4 star”
Reviews.Author: JacqChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 9 nights and really can't say enough about how much help Mounira and Edyta at the front desk helped our stay. Both women would do anything to help. I am directional challenged and they drew maps, recommended restaurants and did everything they could to make the trip pleasant. The area is very close to the Louvre and the Seine and Ideal for water trips to the Eiffel Tower. There are lots of cafes in the area. One night Mounira recommended a wonderful place for dinner, La Cordonnerie. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! I've found my Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Isabella179
Reviews.Content: When planning a trip to Paris this past summer (August 2009), I booked a hotel in the same neighborhood through a travel website, before consulting Tripadvisor. Thankfully, I did because I seemingly avoided an undesirable experience. Our stay in Paris was brief (only two nights) and we wanted to be in a central location, staying at a reasonably priced hotel, that would be clean, safe, and comfortable. The Louvre Sainte Anne Opera was that and more! The hotel almost gives the ambiance of being a bed and breakfast. The staff, in particular, Meuna, were extremely accommodating. Not only did she provide us with color-coded directions to Versailles, she gave us an excellent restaurant recommendation. The location, which is within walking distance to the Louvre and the Opera is amazing. I can't say enough good things about this hotel, except for that the next time I'm in Paris, I'll be sure to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: hisiq_82
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel to stay in the middle of Paris. It's very near to Pyramides Metro Station, so easy for moving around. Lourve Museum is a stone throw away. So does Palais Garnier. The room is small but very nice. Same with the bathroom. The staffs is very very friendly and very helpful in many ways. Always greets you and ask how's your trip and so on. There are many Japanese restaurants on the same street. Abundant ATMs nearby. Don't forget to buy Paris Visite ticket for moving around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: tripsmomma
Reviews.Content: The hotel had the most wonderful staff. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. The basement level of the hotel has a small dining room that served breakfast (eggs, potatos, bacon, danish, coffee, juice)--it was great! The location is very close to the Louve and the metro/bus stops. I suggest getting a multiday metro/bus ticket and you can get on/off as much as you want, it worked out great! Highly recommend this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, excellent staff, highly recommeneded.”
Reviews.Author: ArthursBoy
Reviews.Content: Small but perfectly formed describes this hotel set in an ideal location within five minutes walk from the Louvre. We walked from the hotel to the Latin Quarter in thirty minutes and with three Metro stations within a few hundred metres the whole of Paris is easy to get to. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate with good air conditioning, Sat TV, en suite bath and shower and a very comfortable double bed. Above all our room was clean and fresh and very quiet at night despite being on the front of the hotel. There were no drawers to put clothes in but the wardrobe had ample hanging space. The staff in particular the two ladies are brilliant, very friendly and and willing to offer advice on everything from where to eat to the best way to travel and which 'bateaux' company to use for river trips. They also speak good English. Buffet style breakfast in the cosy room in the basement was again simple but very good with a choice of cooked eggs and bacon. Bearing in mind its location the price is very reasonable and offers good value. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to friends and indeed have already done so. It is realy quite a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Knuck_9
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel. The location is ideal, the cost is moderate, the staff are exceptional and the rooms are very clean, albeit small. We stayed in a double room on the fifth floor with a terrace overlooking the street and the Basilique du Sacré-Cœur. A table with two chairs occupied the terrace making it ideal for breakfast and afternoon drinks. Our two teenage boys stayed in their own room on the fourth floor. The location is perfect. Paris is a walking city. The hotel is only a short walk from the Louvre, the Opera and the Jardin des Tuileries. Three different Metro lines are also within short walking distance. All rooms include wireless internet which was great for the boys and your business needs if you, like myself, have the unfortunate need to work during your stay. Their is a cosy breakfast room in the hotel which offers a very nice buffet style breakfast. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. All of their recomendations were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in upscale neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ritzbiztraveler
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel a lot. Pros: location, helpful staff, bright decor Cons: room is small. one of the bathroom bulbs kept going out when it overheated. No toiletries, thin towels. I booked through Expedia, but then saw a lower rate on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Tman2now
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the staff to be so helpful and friendly. Mouna and Edyta were both so very helpful in directing us to our destinations and great places to eat. Try Hugo's restaurant "La Cordonnerie" if you enjoy great food on cozy little side street. Free WIFI in the room that worked, great air conditioning and free coffee in the morning and convenient location (Louve, D' Orsey, Opera) made this a great place for us. Be prepared for a small room. If you are departing by train at Gare Nore you can catch the bus right outside the hotel for an easy 20 min ride to the station. There is a grocery store 2 blocks away that had all the basics that you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Garry69
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this charming little hotel in Paris last month and defenitly would recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Paris. The hotel is in a fantastic location (less than 10 min walk from Le Louvre & just few minutes from L'Opera), the staff are very friendly and helpful. I stayed only for a couple of days and every day the room was cleaned and left in an immaculate condition. Alessandra

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: im70schild
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to stay at Louvre Sainte Anne, and my wife's first. As always, the staff were so friendly and helpful. I always enjoy eating breakfast in the cellar of the hotel, its so nice and cozy. And the hotel is close to the Louvre and d'Orsay museums. Additionally, my wife also liked the assortment of Asian restaurants adjacent to the hotel. Will definately stay here again for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in area for price, but the real jewel is Moon - receptionist, but really the best concierge in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: ZoeMor
Reviews.Content: Service is unbelievable! Moon, the receptionist, is the real reason most of the travelers I met loved this place. She knew the best cheap, mid-priced, and high-end restaurants. Want a show? "Don't bother with that one, do this one." Want a tour --"you will like this part but not that." "That is too much to pay, try this." We ignored her advice 5 times and we were sorry 5 times. The owners need to double her salary - I presumed she owned the hotel. You will love the location -- three blocks from the Louvre and three from the Opera house, one block from both the main street and the equivalent of a large Walmart. We love the Louvre area and we have stayed in several hotels near this one. Last trip was Hotel Baudelaire (nice manager but the rooms are not nearly as nice as St Anne). We have also stayed in 4-5 star hotels in the area. St Anne rooms are small but have everything you need and everything works. Air works well, hair dryer is powerful. Forgot a three prong adapter? -- don't worry, Moon keeps one for you. We stayed 7 days the first round, and then I booked it again later.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Clean Rooms, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kovacib
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed here for 6 nights in late May 09 and found this quaint little hotel to be in the perfect location within walking distance to the River Seine and Louvre and many other attractions and restaurants. Very quite street and although the rooms were quite small they were adequate and very clean and the bathroom was clean also. The lady at the reception was so helpful giving us lots of travel tips and always willing to go out of her way to assist us with taxi's and train information etc. The one down side is the small lift to squeeze into with suitcases and the narrow staircases but that is the only negative I have and its nothing to really worry about. I would definately recommend this hotel to couples as it may be a bit small for families and would go back there without hesitation on my next holiday to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, and room!”
Reviews.Author: Snuffles3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon. The room was clean and quiet (we were in Room 52 on the top floor, with a balcony - well worth it!). Staff were super helpful. They have the BEST breakfast ever! Made the fluffiest omelets we've ever tasted. Chocolate croissants were so fresh. Location was super central as well. They also have free wii fi which was a bonus. I'd definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with this one!”
Reviews.Author: Joy1939
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of many of the sights you are in Paris to see, very clean, good price compared to other Paris hotels. And the best "feature" of the hotel is the delightful, charming front desk person Moun. She is so willing to help with any questions you might have, fun to talk to, has a great sense of humor - my sister and I loved her!
