The room was small but very acceptable, the A/C so appreciated as it was quite warm and humid during our stay, we made use of the Wi-Fi internet connection. We do not have any complaints about our stay at this hotel, would stay here again, and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Base”
Reviews.Author: D_TravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights (not nearly enough) at this Hotel and found the location, staff, amenities and general ambience of the Hotel exemplary. The small things made our trip the more memorable- notably the wonderful and helpful staff. This Hotel is located in a magnificent position to explore Paris, and we always felt very safe , even walking around at midnight. We walked to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, Arc De Triumph and Galleries Layfette (for those wanting to shop). The rooms are on the small side (no more so than the rest of the European Hotels we stayed in) but if you are visiting Paris to stay in your hotel room all day then I think you have missed the point of the trip. Definitely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, safe location...”
Reviews.Author: sandcake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in early May 2009. We took the RER B from CDG airport to pyrimades metro stop and 2 minute walk (2 very short blocks) to Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne. The hotel is situated in Japan town in Paris so there are several Japanese and 1 Vietnamese restaurant across the street. The neighborhood is safe even at night. Check in was a bit confusing because we reserved our room online but they were already booked. Front desk woman named Mona straightened things out and we ended up with a quiet room as we requested. We took the small elevator to our room where we had to stick our room key to get electricity flowing. The room was very small but clean and engulfed by a full size bed, 2 nightstands, no clock, bureau with safe, minibar, and no balcony. Small bathroom (only 1 person at a time) looked remodeled with new tiles, towel warmer, bathtub with shower head but no shower curtain/door so water spilled onto floor. We laid towel on floor so as not to slip. When we left our rooms, we took the room card key out of the electricity slot so we couldn't recharge our batteries unless we were there. We had to leave the key with the front desk. We got excellent directions and tips from Mona before heading to Louvre Museum (5 minute walk), Versaille (take RER C to outside of Paris), pantheon, Notre Dame (10 minute bus ride), Eiffel Tower (10 minute via metro), Arc d' Triomphe (10 min via metro), Sacre de Coeur (15 min via metro) and Monoprix (2 min walk). She is very knowlegable and friendly and so is the rest of the staff. They let us print our boarding passes for free. We didn't eat hotel breakfast because we found some great bakeries with fresh chocolate croissants and juice around the corner plus Monoprix supermarket had everything else. There were also 2 convenient stores 2 blocks away opened until 11pm. We didn't spend much time in our room so we didn't really care about size. Location and safety was more important. We wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: sfcapps
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were by far the most helpful I've ever come across! The location is perfect, less than a 10 minute walk to the Louvre and about 20 to the Musee d'Orsay. The free wifi was an absolute plus!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: sydneyteacher
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Louvre St Anne and could not fault it.The rooms though compact were more than sufficient for my daughter and myself.The people at the front desk,especially Mona were extremely helpful with tourist advice plus taking care of our little needs.After losing my jacket at the Moulin Rouge they rang several times to try to get it back for me.It is conveniently located to most attractions yet quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: PJGJAG
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel following Tripadvisor reviews and were glad we did. Very easy access to the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay. 2 minutes walk from the 39 bus direct from Gare du Nord (or Gare de l'Est). 2 Minutes walk from the Pyramides Metro. Very friendly and helpful staff, and a good buffet breakfast. The room was small but adequate and a bath (rather than shower) suited us. The shaver socket was French style, rather than international, so bring your adaptor! With the current exchange rate for the pound against the euro, Paris is expensive but the Louvre Sainte Anne offered excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for wheelchair users visiting Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Childshillwanderer
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for disabled travelers wanting to visit Paris. On a direct accessible bus route (39) from Gare du Nord and Gare d'Est and within easy walking distance of the Opera, Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. Very friendly and helpful staff. A ground floor room for wheelchair users with wide doors and an adapted bathroom. Very good value if booked early!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: PeterFromSweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne for four nights and we were very satisfied with our visit. The staff were friendy and polite and gave us excellent recommendations about nice resurants in the neighborhood. The room was nice and clean and the breakfast buffet was really nice. The bathroom was however quite small. The hotel is located in a street whith many asian resturants, and we dinn't like the immediate surrondings. We appreachiated the short distance to the nearest metro station made it easier to discover a big city as Pris.

Reviews.Title: “very good service, that made my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dieter336
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend to Paris and booked a hotel thru tripadvisor in the area of the Louvre. Everything was well organized and all my questions at the desk was so well answered by Mounira, she has the human touch that everybody needs in a city where you dont know the places, the people and the language. I recomend this hotel to everybody going to Paris!!! Have a great stay like we did. Pieter

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding 3 Star Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: beechmi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several 3 star hotels in Paris, and was hesitant about trying a new one. But recently I found myself in need of a room for one night in Paris and wanted to stay close to the hotel I would be moving to for the rest of my trip. So after reading the glowing reviews of the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne I decided to try it and I am very happy I did. My comments and ratings of this property are based upon it as a 3 star hotel, and the expectations that go along with such a property. Hotel star ratings are based upon the services the hotel provides, but not the quality of such services. This is especially important to understand and consider in a city like Paris where an enormous premium is based upon location, size and service. The hotel is located on Rue Sainte Anne which I found safe and well lit, and a short 5 minute walk to either the Louvre or Opera. The area the hotel is in is noted for its Japanese and Asian restaurants (with the Japanese restaurant across the road being extremely popular). There are also several other places to eat, drink and shop located just a minutes walk north off of Rue Sainte Anne on Rue des Petits Champs. My room was located on the ground floor (windows facing the side street off of Rue Sainte Anne). During the day and early evening the noise from the street was a bit loud with the window open, but virtually disappeared with the window closed. The noise died down substantially later at night, but if noise is an issue for you and you prefer the windows in your room open I would suggest a room on a higher floor. The bed was a queen size and extremely comfortable. I am very tall (6 feet 4 inches) and have had back surgery twice and found both the size and comfort of the bed excellent. Although the room was not large it was big enough for me to comfortably move around the bedroom and the bathroom (and this is saying something in Paris!). The furnishings of the room were adequate and charming, and in great condition and well maintained. There was plenty of room for my luggage and a small armoire with a safe that worked. The linens were fresh and clean with plenty of pillows. A small flat screen TV was provided that had several English and French stations. The bathroom was a extremely clean and quite large by Paris standards (I believe I was in a room designed for a disabled person) with a European style shower. Towels were average but functional and the room was well lit. The front desk staff both day and night were extremely helpful, pleasant, and spoke excellent English. Edyto during the day was exceptionally kind and attentive. Wireless internet service was provided (free of charge) and worked very well. I had breakfast in the small but charming breakfast room in the basement which was simple but an excellent value at 12 euro. There was a small selection of cold cereals, meats, cheese, croissants, fruit, yogurts, etc, as well as warm sausages, bacon and potatoes. Also there was a woman who served coffee, tea, chocolate, and cooked eggs (although I am not sure if she prepared anything like pancakes or waffles). The food was good by Parisian standards and an excellent price. Overall the room and hotel were extremely comfortable, clean, and well maintained. This isn't the Ritz or the Hotel George V (I have stayed at both), but for this part of Paris at these prices I cannot imagine you will find a better value. For what its worth after my one night stay at the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne I moved to the Le Grand Hotel Intercontinental across from the Opera for several nights. My 'Superior Room' rate was 750 euro a night (I used hotel points) and plenty of people were paying it. Although I think its unfair to attempt to compare the two properties, what I will tell you is that I will definitely return to the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne, as well as recommend it to my friends and family. And what I remember about Le Grand Hotel Intercontinental is how outrageously expensive it was.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service,clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: angelo65Geneva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night.Generally I book 4 or 5 star hotels in Paris but after reading the reviews I thought I'd give it a try. The location is great but I didn't really like the street.Full of Japanese restaurants and not a very Parisian feeling.My room was on the street side and was quite noisy if you sleep with an open window.Room was small but did the job.I really appreciated the immaculate bed sheets and pillow.The bathroom was spotless and fresh.bravo because Paris hotels in this category are very seldom so well maintained.The room was air-conditionned and had a flat-screen T.V.The reception staff were smiling and helpful.I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Stasus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights (romantic getaway) in early March and were really impressed. The front desk staff were polite and extremely helpful and spoke very good English. The best part of this hotel is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. You are literally right around the corner from the Louvre, 3 blocks from the Opera, 1/2 block from the metro and are surrounded by decent restaurants! On our first day we walked to the Louvre, down through Tulieres Gardens to the Champs d'Elysees (decent view of the Arc de Triomphe), across the river to Les Invalides, past the Ecole Militaire and went up the Eiffel Tower! Which was all the more impressive as she was 7 months pregnant! The staff also pointed us to a bus stop a block a way where we were able to go directly to the Catacombs (highly recommended). The rooms are small, as was expected but were very clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again and think that it was great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: RobD1973
Reviews.Content: Very homely hotel with good wheelchair access to Room 1. Very helpful staff who assisted us with any query we had. Room was relatively small but the great location made up for that. Only downside was that there was no kettle or coffee in our room so had to pay 3 euros a cup.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MCemEren
Reviews.Content: I booked a 5th floor double room, called superior double with small balcony. First of all, everything was as promised. The staff was beyond being helpful, I will never forget the dinner I had thru the recommendation of our first contact at the hotel. Yes the room is small but this is the heart of Paris, I was not planning to run horses in the flat. I had peaceful nights and mornings. The breakfast was good enough to start a happy day. Thanks, Sante Anne...

Reviews.Title: “They LIe”
Reviews.Author: hepsfolly
Reviews.Content: Small room - not great location but lamp in room did not work and got a new bulb -this did not help later I plugged in my converter and hair dryer only to have sparks fly - the hotel took the dryer and said they would see what their insurance company would say. The dryer was just used once as it was brand new and yet I was told it was dropped and broken. Yes probably by the hotel staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great location for exploring Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tracyal
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Louvre Saint Anne was absolutely wonderful, especially Mon (sp?). She went out of her way to make sure we were taken care of and gave several wonderful suggestions for sightseeing and dinner. She was an amazing host and we felt like we were staying with a friend. Overall the hotel was very nice and the rooms were clean and spacious - by Paris standards. I came in expecting a much smaller room so my standards were low based on a previous stay in Paris and stays in other european cities. The hotel is conveniently located near a metro station and supermarket-type store that had groceries, hygiene items and clothes. This is perfect in case you forget something or just want to buy some water or snacks without breaking the bank. The staff suggested several wonderful places to eat that were within walking distance to the hotel. Overall, the location is wonderful for walking to several sites (Louvre, Opera, etc.) and virtually anything can be reached by the train or metro. The breakfast was excellent and the room was very nicely decorated. Also, free WiFi in the room was a definite bonus. Overall, a great hotel for exploring Paris with an amazing staff to help you feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel !”
Reviews.Author: cracker115
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel alot , we have stayed in many hotels and resorts. And I have to say that this little hotel was without a doubt one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. When you stay here you are right in the middle of everything. The Louvre and the Orsay musuem are both a short walk away, additionally you are in the opera area. Eelegant shopping is right near-by, as is a French supermarket. The rooms themselves are small but very very charming. The beds were extremely comfortable, and we enjoyed the LCD television and the free wi-fi. The breakfast area was very very nice and the food there was delicious and will definitely get you ready for a long day of sight-seeing. But all of this was not the true charm of the hotel. The real charm is found in the hotel staff. They were nothing short of outstanding. The day staff speak very very good english and were EXTREMELY helpful with both recommendations and directions. With their help...my wife and I were actually able to find the French Bistro that we dined at when we were visiting Paris right after we were married...and for that I will always always be grateful. This hotel is nothing short of a delight and we will defintely be back !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Corkog
Reviews.Content: Great location with the Lourve and the opera house around the corner. The location was great for walking around and seeing the other landmarks too. Didnt find the staff overly friendly but it didnt deter from our stay. We didnt get breakfast as they were plenty of places to grab breakfast or a bite to eat. The room was small but clean but with so much to see you dont spend all that long in your room anyway. We had a room on the first floor but didnt find it too noisy expect for the gurgling of the water above us all night. Paris itself was lovely with loads of beautiful old buildings and plenty to see and do. Found dinner and drinks a bit overpriced though. Also i booked the hotel through their website and got a discount for booking online.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Price to Quality Ratio”
Reviews.Author: DonRevie
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this superbly located Hotel. If going to Paris it is important to understand that in the central historic areas you just don't find big high rise international hotels. The vast majority are small street front boutique style 3 or 4 star hotels. Rooms are 'compact' but adequate in this hotel just as in all others. If you do manage to find a big suite style room you'll pay a small fortune for it. At 165 Euros per night for a 'superior double' with balcony on an upper floor this hotel represents excellent value for money in Paris. You can easily pay a lot more - sometimes for less in terms of quality. The only reason I don't give this five stars is because the decor in this popular gem is becoming slightly tired. Don't get me wrong - the room decor adequate and the standard of cleanliness is excellent but it's time for a bit of light re-decorating. A spot of paint here and there, some fresh wallpaper and revamped flooring and this place just couldn't be beaten at the price. My comments above on decor don't apply to bathrooms which are in pristine condition. Staff - all of them were wonderful. I endorse all previous comments made about their helpfulness and attention to detail. Location is simply superb for sightseeing on foot. 10 mins walking time to The Louvre and 10 - 20 mins for many other famous landmarks. For the really adventurous walker - The Eiffel Tower is about 45 mins away with a return walk via Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees taking another 1 hour. If you get hung up on small details having to add up to perfection then hotels in central Paris aren't going to be for you. If however you can be happy with charming plus very good standards rather than perfect then this hotel is for you. I will definitely go back if visiting Paris in the future. By the way - Paris is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Paris Standards”
Reviews.Author: MacRobertson
Reviews.Content: At first sight it doesn't look nice nor attractive but it turned to be an excellent choice for Paris hotel standards. I was a bit scared we were on the first floor, our room facing the noisy and busy street below, but the isolation is perfect and you can hear nothing. Beds are quite comfortable, bathroom is spotless. One block away from the subway (Pyramides). In front of the hotel there is an excellent japanesse restaurant which seems to be a major hit with the locals. Long lines for entering, so you should try it at night. Hotel vicinity is not the best but it's ok. Full of oriental eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NekoCat
Reviews.Content: The St. Anne is a very nice small boutique hotel situated in a 'Japan Town' area and walking distance to many popular tourist attractions. The Metro is very close by, as well as, a parking garage for those who drive. Our room was small, but the location, price and cleanliness made up for the size. Our room had a small flat screen TV, air conditioning and a mini fridge. There was a window to open, which was nice, but no view at all. The hotel was quiet our entire stay and the staff are very friendly. They offer a breakfast, but there are an unlimited number of places to grab breakfast, dinner or a drink right near the hotel. I would recommend to any budget minded traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Habemus locum per dormire”
Reviews.Author: Norbiius
Reviews.Content: After many stays in Paris I have already used some good *** - hotels, but the hotel "Louvre Sainte Anne" is real on the top of this category. The rooms are very clean and practically furnished. The environment is quite calm and the public binding (Metro 14, bus 21) is very good. Also the situation between Louvre and opera can be able to be seen. We were satisfy come back next year surley.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: Cruptown
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne in Paris from 9/7/08-9/11/08. It was an exceptional stay and met all of our expectations. We booked online at the hotel's website and paid E145 per night. It was our first trip to Paris and this hotel was a perfect choice. The hotel is centrally located in 1ER - one block off Ave. de l'Opera on a quiet street. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the Metro (either the Pyramides or Palais Royal stations). It is a 10-15 minute walk to The Louvre, Tuileries, and Seine. There are many nearby restaurant options (most near Louvre or Opera), a post office, internet cafe, and Monoprix store (Parisian version of a Super Target - including food and wine). After our long flights and the train/metro trip into Central Paris, we were warmly welcomed at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne. Our reservation was in order and while our room was not ready (we arrived at the hotel about 11AM and didn't expect the room to be ready), we were able to freshen up in an empty guest room off the lobby and leave our luggage before setting out to explore the city. The reception staff was extremely helpful, notably Muan and Edyta. We were given advice on the Metro, attractions, coupons, and general information about the city. The staff spoke English well yet also helped us to learn more French! After our return, we checked into Room 304. The elevator is small, but can easily fit two - although it's tight with luggage! The room met our expectations and matched the description on the website. Our room matched Photo #3 - Twin. The room is tight, but we expected that. The room was clean and had a charming French window overlooking the street. The room included a TV, phone, and safe (which we didn't use). The bathroom was bigger than expected and nicely tiled. The shower/tub was fine, although did not include a shower curtain and made for a challenge to keep the floor dry. There was a glass divider between the shower and sink which generally worked fine to keep the water in. The room did smell of cigarette smoke, but again we accepted this and it quickly became an afterthought. The beds were quite comfortable and the room was quiet (from both the hallway and street). The room was cleaned daily. My only two suggestions for improvement might be lighting in the hallways and key access at the main entrance. The hallways were very dark (although it really didn't matter that much since our door was right next to the elevator). If we were out later, the front door is locked and you must use a buzzer to get the attention of the desk staff. On more than one occasion we had to wait a few minutes before staff returned to let us in, but the street is full of life and very safe. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet on our last morning. It was E12 per person. The breakfast room is lovely with cheery tables and rustic stone walls - exactly as shown on the website. The buffet includes eggs cooked-to-order, pastries, fruit, yogurt, meats, potatoes, cheese, cereal, and various beverages. The service was great and my friend raved about the coffee. While we found it more convenient to just eat on the run most mornings, the buffet is definitely worth considering if you want a larger breakfast. Overall our stay at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne was wonderful. I'd highly recommend the hotel to friends and stay there again when I return to Paris. Between the superb location, friendly staff, and quality accommodations, it's an excellent choice for first-time visitors or Paris pros.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable and clean, very nice staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: UsualSuspect01
Reviews.Content: Excellent rating not because hotel was fancy, but because staff was very nice and helpful, the hotel felt clean and safe, and it is a great location for visiting all of central Paris. We could walk to Louvre in 5 min, Opera 5 min, D' Orssay in 15 min, Saint Germain 20 minutes, Everything was a 10 Euro or less Cab fare. Thank you, too Moon (SP?) at the front desk who made our stay extra special. Thanks also to the front desk gentleman at night, who helped us arrange an extra nights stay when we were mistreated at another hotel. My girfreind and I have visited Paris several times and stayed in a number of hotels. This hotel is a good basic choice if you you just want a clean, safe place from which to visit the sites. If you want a fancy lobby and lounge it's a 5-10 minute walk to the Ritz or the Westin. Be careful not to confuse this hotel with two others with a similair name.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Above average”
Reviews.Author: TomasTraveller
Reviews.Content: Good, friendly staff. Small, but nice rooms. Clean. Very good location. We will be back. I could not rate it as excellent, but it is very very close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: west32
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great location, clean, safe, in a quiet street. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Steffi
Reviews.Content: Decided to 'splurge' while in Paris and stay at a hotel rather than a hostel. The hotel was better than I expected, and in a great location. Staff was friendly, and helpful - gave me great advice regarding local shopping and museums. The Louvre was just a five minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: bitian
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a quiet street in central Paris close to the Louvre. Very close to the underground station Pyramides. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. Rooms are small but very clean with air conditioning and LCD TV. What really makes this hotel is the staff, especially Moun. I have never stayed at a Hotel where a staff member has been so friendly and helpful. She was helpful with recommending restaurants and happy to answer any questions that you had. If you are going to stay in Paris definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our Paris adventures”
Reviews.Author: EpiSeattle
Reviews.Content: Easy to manage location, fantastic front desk staff, comfortable rooms. OK, they are not large rooms, but this is Paris! The air conditioning worked great on the hotest of days and the bed was comfortable. We loved how easy it was to get to the Metro or bus, a cafe, the Louvre, worthy restaurants for dinner, and more. When needed we had friendly and efficient help/directions from the front desk staff. We were very happy with our stay at the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne.

Reviews.Title: “location good”
Reviews.Author: poppynz
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Walking distance to Louvre, bus tours departure point, restaurants and shops. Our only disappointment was we were in room number one. It was on the ground floor next to reception. We could hear people walking past and the phone ringing in reception. We checked in at 5.30pm and our room wasn't ready we were told to come back in an hour. No offer of shower or anything. We enquired about ordering a taxi for 9am and the reception incorrectly ordered it immediately - we weren't even packed and had to rush. If booking be sure to state that you do not want a ground floor room. All that aside - we were so busy looking at sights that we didn't spend much time in the room. It was small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashlyn2
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two nights of our stay in Europe in this hotel and loved it. We had a room on the top floor with a view from the balcony to Sacre Couer which was lovely. We found it to be very centrally located, within walking distance of many attractions. The staff were incredibly helpful, the most helpful of our seven weeks of touring. Recommended a dinner cruise on the Seine which was magic. We didn't have breakfast there but as others have said there is a great little cafe on the corner, very yummy croissants and coffee! Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again if we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: broadway
Reviews.Content: 11 of us stayed at this hotel recently for a family celebration. It is stiuated in a great location, in walking distance of the Louvre, the Opera and the metro. The hotel itself was great. The reception staff were extremely helpful & nothing was too much trouble which added to our memorable stay. The rooms were small as stated by others but I wouldn't expect anything else in the centre of Paris. All of our 6 rooms were very clean, had a safe, mini bar, hairdryer, good size bathroom and one even had a balcony with a stunning view of Sacre Coeur. I think some people who have written other reviews are fussy & hard to please. I wouldn't hesitate in going back again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel if language is a concern”
Reviews.Author: Cordova_Bay_Folks
Reviews.Content: Like others say, if you expect an american sized room look elsewhere, but if you want a really great Parisienne experience then they don't get better than this. The hotel is very small - 4 rooms per floor, but each room has a nice new bathroom. Our room was large enough to have two huge suitcases open on tables, and still be able to walk comfortably around the bed. What more do you need? The staff are WONDERFUL and really help if you as they are fluent in English and other languages. Each morning they greet you (in English) with an offer to help you plan your way to wherever you are going and really do try to make your trip as enjoyable as possible. We left our camera in a taxi and they made all the phone calls for us (language barrier) and even paid the taxi driver the fare he charged to return the camera, having faith that we would reimburse them when we returned from siteseeing. The location of the hotel is ideal for walking to the sites and to the Seine River where you can hop on a ferry and go everywhere. I will definitely be recommending it to all my friends. By the way, don't let the outside of the hotel scare you when you get there - it is nothing to look at - doesn't even look like a hotel. It really is one of the best hotels around. P&L, Victoria BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & very good value”
Reviews.Author: DocBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of May 2008. We had a very nice room on the fourth floor with a distant view of the Sacre Coeur. The room, bed and bathroom were clean and comfortable and the hotel was very quiet; no noise at night and volume limiter on the TV. We ate breakfast twice and enjoyed it -- plentiful and fresh with decent coffee. By contacting the hotel directly I got a slightly discounted B&B rate. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We arrived late on the first night (about 10 pm) and ate quickly in one of the local Japanese restaurants -- the food was very good, and reasonable. We also had a nice meal in a French restaurant up the road at no. 52 (the hotel is no. 32) called La Souris Verte. Good, fresh food from a fairly standard French menu, 25 euros for three courses, excellent service and relaxed atmosphere in an old, beamed dining room. We walked everywhere, but got the metro at Pyramides on the way back to CDG -- one stop to Chatelet then RER B all the way to the airport. In all a very good trip and the hotel was the foundation for a relaxing time. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Has Pros and Cons...”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaMartini
Reviews.Content: Booked based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not has happy as some others that have reviewed. 2 of our group had room on ground floor. They could not open their window as there were men standing right outside smoking. If curtains were not closed people could look right in window. Our room was on 2nd floor and as another reviewer mentioned there was an odor in the bathroom. I found the bedspread was quite grey looking. That turned me off immediately. On a positive note... the staff were very friendly and helpful. They provided us with wine glasses and coffee the first morning. The breakfast area was cute, though we chose to go to the cafe on the corner. Awsome pastries and coffee there. The location was good, close to Louvre, Opera, and lots of restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewtravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sainte Anne Louvre is in a fantastic, central location in Paris. You can walk to just about any attraction from there. The staff are very friendly, helpful and efficient. The bathroom was nice and the rooms are nice but very small. If you had a lot of luggage or had limited mobility it would be a problem. We had to "dance" around each other in the room to move about. It was in a pretty quiet spot. They serve a good, fresh buffet breakfast. We had a lovely stay there for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful French experience”
Reviews.Author: TheAustralians
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a charming and very professionally run quiet haven in a fantastic location in Paris. It is roughly a 3 minute walk to the Louvre and the River and is in the Opera Quarter. The staff told us via email that we could leave our suitcases at the hotel after our 6am arrival until check in time that afternoon. When we arrived we were whisked off to breakfast downstairs and then given one of our 2 rooms straight away at no extra charge. It was very much appreciated after 2 long and tiring flights from Australia. We never got to meet the famous Moun, but the staff we did meet were absolutely fantastic – Edyta, Bernie and Enoch. They encouraged our terrible attempts at French, wrote down little phrases for us to say, and looked after the four of us like we were family. The rooms were great, we had the ones right on the top floor with little balconies, and they had every single thing you could need. I loved this place, we felt safe and secure and very welcome on our first trip to Paris. We ate in the little breakfast room every morning and the food was divine. We didn’t want a glitzy tourist hotel, so if you like the Ritz, go stay there. We will definitely go back again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien!”
Reviews.Author: weegiegal
Reviews.Content: The location is the main reason for recommending and writing this review, my husband and I visited Paris with friends (another couple) one night, the guys went for a drink and we went to get ready for dinner, neither of us felt intimidated walking back to the hotel through the narrow streeets off Avenue Opera. The Metro stations are handy but walking lets you see more and you are only minutes from the Louvre and the Seine. As mentioned the rooms are small but we found them sufficient, generally you are not in Paris to sit in a hotel room. They are clean and had everything we needed including a safe for any valuables. It is worth eating breakfast in the hotel we tried finding a cafe outside and the quality and price weren't really worth the effort. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. The receptionist even apologised for the awful weather but being Scottish we are used to that! We all thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this hotel and would highly recommend it to everyone. In fact another friend has booked already! The hotel only has about 20 rooms so book it if you want a centrally located room at a reasonable price. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Staff make this hotel the Best in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: canuckpump
Reviews.Content: Maun.....you are amazing !!! As well as the rest of the staff at this wonderful property. Perfect location by the opera, close to everything including bikes, taxis, shuttle bus to CDG, louvre, opera and the beautiful Seine river. Great breakfast, loved the eggs. Clean room. Tiny , but thats Paris, if you want a large room...stay home!

Reviews.Title: “super location---super staff”
Reviews.Author: Porscheboy
Reviews.Content: Visited Paris 26th-28th February 2008 and after much research we decided to stay at the Louvre Sainte Anne. It turned out to be a very good choice beacause not only is the hotel superbly located--close to Opera and the Louve-- the staff, especially Moun and Edyta who run the reception, were very helpful both with hotel issues and recommendations and advice concerning restaurants and travel questions. The hotel is par for the course when it comes to room sizes for Paris--small but perfectly clean and to a good standard of finish. The bathroom had complimentary toiletries and a daily change of towels. Nice touch in the room--a LCD flatscreen TV--only one problem--No English channels except for the dreaded CNN!!! All in all a super place to stay and enjoy the many delights of Paris. Two restaurant recommendations--Le Mesturet, 77 Rue de Richelieu close to the hotel and a super bistrot close to the Eiffel Tower--the Le Petit Troquet at 28,Rue de l'Exposition.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: Smiler141
Reviews.Content: Following a thorough search of reviews we decided to go to the Louvre St Anne, 1st arr, for a 3-night stay - and what a great choice! The location is amazing; ideal for a whistle-stop tour of the city. The room was extremely clean, and was serviced everyday to a high standard (and my standards are high!). Whilst bijou (well, is it Paris), it fitted our needs. The staff were very friendly - and humoured my rather rusty french! What a delight! Can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 22Oscar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet side street in an area with several Japanese restaurants. The location is excellent if you want to visit the Louvre, Opera or Place de Concorde. The rooms are very small but have every thing you need and are very reasonable for a hotel in this location. The staff were extremely freindly. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located clean, small hotel with great stuff.”
Reviews.Author: malenky
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is perfectly situated on a quiet side street at the halfway point between Opera and Louvre, there are a few Japanese restaurants within two blocks of the hotel, and the hotel is close to the metro and to the OpenTour bus stop. Also the supermarket is a 2 min walk. We have been walking to the Louvre and to the Opera, and even across the Seine to Latin Quarter. The rooms are small, but with a big window, bit outdated (yet have a small flat screen), have a separate tiled bathroom with a tub and shower and a towel warmer. The bed is OK, and the cleaning stuff is efficient. The hotel provided great advice, and everyone at the front desk spoke English well. We didn’t have breakfast in the underground stone cellar, but there are plenty of little cafes that will serve you coffee and a croissant for 4-5 EUR. Ask the front desk and they will guide you. We have trusted the front desk with both breakfast and lunch suggestions. The only real downside to the room was that the heating was sufficiently aggressive (either on at full blast or off) that we usually just turned it off at night.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping Excursion!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad3
Reviews.Content: My sister and I came to Paris for a short shopping excursion and found this hotel via TripAdvisor recommendations. Reviews were spot on as the hotel was a 10 minute walk to the shopping department stores just to the north and a 10 euro taxi ride to luxury stores just to the south across the river. After an exhausting day of shopping, we were able to pop into any of the numerous asian restaurants lining our hotel's street. Rooms were small as expected but very tidy. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Yet Again”
Reviews.Author: 100Club
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have stayed at the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne a number of times over the years and it is the friendliness of the staff who cannot do enough to help, the cosy rooms, excellent location, and value for money that keep us coming back. We particularly appreciate being located in the heart of Paris' Japanese district, and within walking distance of the Louvre, Palais Royal, Opera and department stores.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mary_1234
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris in November every year for Christmas shopping. We stayed in La Pera last year but the prices had almost doubled this year so I went in search of a different hotel for this years trip. I looked on Trip Advisor and found the Louvre St Anne and I booked a triple room at this hotel based on the reviews it had gotten from Tripadvisor guests, its location and price. Overall we were very happy with the hotel. Our room was clean and bright and the bathroom was a good size. We had a small balcony which was nice to sit out on to get some air. The reception was manned 24 hours a day and the receptionists were very friendly and helpful anytime we needed anything. The hotel is close to the Louvre, Opera and the big department stores and there is a metro stop close by which makes the entire city accessible. There were some very nice restaurants in the neighbourhood - Willis Wine Bar and Liza's a Lebanese restaurant were two we ate at. There are also lots of Japanese restaurants along the surrounding streets but we didn't try any of these. Getting to the hotel was relatively straight forward. We got the Roissybus from CDG to Opera and I printed directions from Google Maps from the bus stop to the hotel which was about a 5 minute walk. A few slightly negative points I would make are that the lift is not big, the hallways are narrow and the reception area is small. Our room was also a little small for three people and the third bed was up on a ledge over the double bed. The hotel is however a three star hotel and so overall we felt the amount we had paid versus the other good points mentioned above made the hotel very good value in a city where many of the hotels are dingy and overpriced. Overall we were very happy with our stay and we plan to book this hotel again next year for our annual trip once the price remains reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jotabecu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Oct 17 for 3 nights. Excellent service, cleanliness & location. Good value in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Family birthday”
Reviews.Author: WisetravellerUK
Reviews.Content: This was a family get together for my brother's 50th birthday, with nine people in five rooms. As expected from the reviews, the rooms were small, but very well appointed, clean tidy and attractive. The bathroom was excellent. My wife could not make the trip due to illness so I was using the room as a 'luxury single' For two it might have been a bit cramped, but even so it was quite well laid out for such a small space. Excellent access to Central Paris sights, the Seine and restaurants. Unlike another reviewer, I did not expect tea making facilities in the room as this is not a French (or European) tradition (where it exists in France it is an 'import' from UK and usually in chain hotels as a sop to 'international' guests)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Merkin
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for his fiftieth birthday based on the reviews I had already read. As expected the rooms are small and there were no drawers or tea making facilities. However, the location is excellent, the room clean, the breakfast was good and the staff couldn't be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JJKSydney
Reviews.Content: This was the most fabulous hotel in a great location. The staff were unbelievably friendly and helpful. My daughters and I had the perfect Parisian experience here

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: from_away_friend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Oct 13-20. As it has been said over and over again in previous reviews, you can't beat the location or staff. Moun is the best (and I promised I would mention that she is single...so for all you single guys...). She couldn't do enough for us even calling around for a doctor when hubby had a small medical issue (which thank goodness cleared up quickly). Our room was on the second floor and the only problem we had was that there seem to be a faint odour coming from the bathroom (which we solved by closing the bathroom door). Even with that, this hotel still warrants the excellent rating. Highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler-6
Reviews.Content: I got a recommendation from a friend and I was very happy with the choice. The rooms are a bit small, but it was very clean and the folks working at the front desk were incredibly friendly. Their English was good and I found them helpful. The hotel is located in the middle of what I would probably call "Japantown". We wished we had more time to eat at one of those restaurants because we love Japanese food, but wanted to eat true Parisian food. The hotel is conveniently located near the metro and the Louvre. We were able to walk easily to the great shopping areas, which was a high priority on our list. The hotel also provides free wireless, so that was a plus! They also had a safe where we could store our personal belongings. They had one English channel, CNN, which actually was quite nice to have. And the A/C worked well. The only issue that I had was with one front desk employee who almost pointed us in the wrong direction when we were trying to get a cab to take us to the bus depot (to Beauvois Airport). He didn't even know that that airport existed. Thankfully the cab driver knew exactly where we needed to go. Great hotel! I would stay here again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdeely
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in the 1e section of Paris. Booked our stay from 19th through 23rd October 2007 following excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. Excellent location near the Louvre, Opera, cafes, shopping and fine restaurants. Close to public transportation. Walking distance to many major attractions, including the Louvre & Musee D'Orsay. Though rooms are small, they are well-appointed, modern and meticulously clean. Wonderful staff made all the difference in our trip - each went above and beyond our expectations in arranging transportation, suggesting restaurants and advising us on our day-to-day sightseeing requirements. Our stay occurred during the recent Metro & transportation strikes & thanks to the hotel staff, we were not adversely affected. Have traveled extensively in Europe and this by far was our best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: snappie17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September. The people who work at this hotel are incredible nice, accomodating and genuine. You don't find hotel employees this nice anymore and it was a joy to be able to talk to them. Our room was small, but we did not spend too much time in the room so it did not make a difference. You can't beat the location. 10 minute walk to the Louvre. There were plenty of restaurants in the area. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service”
Reviews.Author: skeeteratredhouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a joy even though the rooms were small (like every room in paris). We arrived late to find expedia had made our reservation wrong...The hotel staff bent over backward to make sure we had a place to sleep, and because the room mix up was our 4 mishap of the evening (missed train/blocked ATM card/no taxis) they told us to have breakfast on the house the next morning so we could turn our luck around. The staff was extrememly friendly, spoke wonderful English, and was more than happy to help with sightseeing recommendations, restaurant reservations and pretty much whatever else we needed. The rooms were tiny, but clean and the location was great for metro access.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiTheBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my teenage son during the rugby world cup. Found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and comfortable. The hotel is located in a great area of paris only a few minutes from the Louvre and only a short metro trip away from the Gar de Nord. Fully intend to use this hotel again, would recommend to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: waltzn_matilda
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne is located in the 1st arrondisement. It is within easy walking distance of the Louvre and many other of Paris' attractions. The hotel itself is small but the rooms are clean and each has an en suite as well as a safe, TV and a bar fridge. I am female and was travelling alone and it was my first time in Paris and I do not speak French. I felt very safe in the streets surrounding the hotel even at night and found the location of the hotel to be very convenient. The street, Rue Sainte Anne, has quite alot of Japanese restaurants. I could see 6 from my window! You're probably not going to Paris to eat Japanese food but if you have a craving for it you will be well accommodated. I did not try the breakfast here, I think it was 12 euros. Instead I went to the little coffee shop at the next cross street (half a block away) and bought a coffee and pastry for 3 euro. I also bought a little treat for myself each evening like a pear or citrus tart. The staff there were very nice and even taught me to say 'take away' in French, although I've forgotten how now. The most impressive thing about the hotel Louvre Sainte Anne was the friendly staff. One lady at the reception in particular was so nice and extremely accommodating. A work colleague of mine was also travelling to Paris. His luggage was lost by the airline and he had only organised accommodation for one night so he had them send his luggage to my hotel once it was found. The hotel kindly stored his luggage for him for the entire day even though he was not a guest there. The lady at reception even phoned the last place he had stayed on my behalf to try to find out where he was. She spent quite a lot of time on the phone for me trying to help me track him down. He showed up eventually oblivious to all the trouble he'd caused. Needless to say I didn't spend any more time with him after handing over his luggage. This is a very friendly, relaxed hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Davidov
Reviews.Content: My favourite Paris hotel. Easy to get to (1 stop on the Metro from the main RER line from Charles de Gaulle airport) and a fantastic location. The rooms are bigger than any I've stayed in in Paris before and the staff are excellent. Breakfast is worth the extra. Couldnt recommend it highly enough. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great Paris gem”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveller29
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne after reading so many good reviews on TripAdvisor. And it did not disappoint. The hotel is smack bang in the middle of everything that we wanted to see and very easy to find from the Gare du Nord where we came into from our home town of London. Closest metro to the hotel is definitely Pyramides as it is a two minute walk to the front door. The hotel is in the Japanese Quarter of the city; literally surrounded by awesome Japanese restaurants. More about that later. The staff were extremely helpful and the lady at reception spoke excellent English which was helpful for hubby who is not a French speaker. The room was very nice and absolutely spotless. We had to make do with two singles pushed together but it was not really a problem. Our room was quiet (4th Floor with lift) and had a very nice clean bathroom. Thankfully there was a good shower that had pressure and plenty of hot water. The hotel does provide a squishy shower/bath bottle, but i'd recommend bringing your own if you want a decent shampoo. There was a hairdryer which was good. The room also had a nice flat screen tv with plenty of French tv channels and Eurosport in English. We also had air con which was great although we did not use it as it was not warm enough at night. We did not try out the breakfast as we woke up too late but it looked very nice on the pictures. We did however try out a Japanese restaurant for Brunch on the Sunday. When in Paris, eat Japanese! It's the one directly opposite the hotel and it was absolutely superb and very reasonable. We ate a few different dishes but the tempura is a must. This is how Japanese food should be made. Forget Wagamama's as this was the real deal. Best seats in the house are in front of the Chefs. They are so in sync they don't even have to speak to one another. It was great to watch them cook our food and with such care and attention. A great experience! We had both visited Paris a few times before but did a few new things that we absolutely loved and we think that everyone should do. We tried out the new Paris by bike initiative; 'Velib' that the Maire of Paris has just started up. There are bike stations all round Paris and there is one right by the hotel. It is a much better way of seeing Paris than taking the metro or even walking. You swipe your credit card (150 EUR deposit each), get a pin code, type it in and then off you go. Despite my apprehension about no helmuts being provided and the initial feeling that i was going to get squished by a crazy driver it was the best experience we had all weekend. The bikes were in excellent working order. Had 3 gears which was more than enough and had excellent Shimano break's. And for the ladies, the saddle was plenty wide and there was a useful basket for water and my handbag! We took the smaller back roads and cycled everywhere , even along the cobbles by the Seine. The Louvre was about 5 minutes away and we were able to get quite close to the Pyramid in the gardens without running anyone over. We cycled along the Saint Honore road with all of the nice shops and even ventured up the Champs Elysee until I lost my nerve as we moved closer to the Arc de Triomphe. The bikes also had a padlock so you could stop and leave them securely. You can also put the bikes back on the rack and take new ones out every time you stop as there are plenty of bike stations dotted around. This is also a good tip because if you can be bothered to change the bike every half an hour you only get charged the initial fee and not the 1 EUR or whatever it is past then, but it is cheap so we didn't bother changing the bikes. We absolutely loved it, so if you go in the summer or can brave the icy winds in winter, use the Velib and stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: petitesoeur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Louvre Sainte Anne for 6 nights in June '07. We were attracted by the good reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The rooms are attractive and comfortable. The petit dejeuner is exceptional. All of the hotel staff are fantastic, very friendly and extremely helpful. If we are lucky enough to return to Paris we will happily stay with them again. Hello to Moun and Edyto. John and Gretchen B.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDfromMEXICO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Sainte Anne Louvre and it was just fantastic! We went to Italy and France for our third honeymoon, and after reviewing lots of comments in Trip Advisor, we decided to stay at Sainte Anne Louvre when being in Paris. I am sure I made the right decision .... Great service from all the people at the hotel, they helped me to get an additional room for one night (we arrived earlier to Paris), good advice for places to visit, very kind and polite. Rooms are quite good, I would say very much above average, very clean - which is the most important issue for me ... bathroom is perfect, A/C included, TV, minibar, safety deposit box, etc etc. Price is reasonable, we paid 116 Euros per night / room which is ok for prices in Paris. Location is great, 5 minute walk and you are at Louvre, Opera, Les Halles, etc. Less than one minute walk and you are at Pyramides Metro Station. Breakfast is also good, 12 Euros I want to thank all the people at Sainte Anne Louvre for a great service and for being part of our great vacations. If we were to visit again Paris, I would definetely stay once more at Saint Anne Louvre. Merci beaucoup! David Barlow from Mexico City

Reviews.Title: “Best location & staff experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: eurowheels
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews of this hotel we booked for 4 nights in July and were not disappointed. The staff are as lovely as everyone says, so helpful and friendly - make you feel part of the family. Our room was kept very clean and although small, had everything we needed, including free wireless internet. We had the disabled room and it is well equipped for wheelchair users, the only small disadvantage is it's on the ground floor so you get a bit of noise from the lobby area, but this did not disturb us at all. Staff helped us book Moulin Rouge tickets, work out wheelchair accessible bus routes and advised on good restaurants in the area. They were also able to shuffle things around at the last minute so we could keep our room for 2 more nights to stay for Bastille Day - in peak season it would have been impossible to do this on our own but they did it without blinking an eyelid. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat5573
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (16th/19th July). As other reviewers have mentioned, the reception staff are very friendly and willing to help. The hotel itself is ok. The room we had (22) was quite small but adequate for the length of our stay. Don't expect too much luxury, but a clean and well located hotel. If you like Japanese food you're in the right place as there's 4 or 5 restaurants on the same street as the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: TeachinNV
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here during the first few days of July. The front desk staff, especially Edith, made our stay wonderful. She was able to book our tour, airport shuttles, and guide us to good restaurants. The hotel is located on a small street near many Japanese restaurants. There is a members-only club across the street that lets out late, and can be noisy. However, it did not keep us from sleeping soundly. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Louvre, and other nearby sights. There is lots of shopping nearby, along with bus routes, and the Metro. The room was small, but very comfortable. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, which is hard to find these days. Overall, I would recommend staying here. I know that I will be returning sometime very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dimasus
Reviews.Content: I and my husband spent 8 days in Paris in June. The location of hotel is just perfect near Louvre, Opera, walking distance from Notre Dam. We made reservation through website of the hotel (145 euro per room). Moun on the reception is so welcome and helpful. She recommended us several really very good restaurants. Our room was on the 4 floor, small, but enough for two person, absolutely spotless, was cleaned every day and very good. We liked to come back in the evening to our hotel for the rest. The room was comfortable and really nice. We didn't take breakfast (12 euro per person), we bought in the nearest shop Monoprix cheese, fruits, youghurt, bread in baulanger PAUL. There are so many restaurants, bistros, cafes in Paris, there is no problem to eat. There are so many interesting places in Paris. We bought museum pass for 6 days (60 museums), no line, very comfortable. The vacation was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk made our stay”
Reviews.Author: LuccaB
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is fine and in a great location, however the people at the front desk made the hotel a 4 star. Mouen goes out of her way to make sure everything is taken care of. She treated us like new born pups in her city. She actually had a look of worry in her eyes when we didn't consult her on our Metro outing. Turns out we should of, but her concern was priceless. We were traveling with our two kids and my mother, so all of her suggestions were so important and were so accurate. Do yourself a favor and make Paris easy, stay at this hotel and be pampered. P.S. Their breakfast ended up being the best out of our 17 day adventure, the coffee is great and the girls preparing it are as sweet as can be. The Hotel St. Anne gets top honors from this family of 5, and Mouen is a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: zx212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited during May. It was overall positive experience. The location was good. Close enough to everything. Some walking is required. The room is small but very clean and well organized. I especially like the window with a view of the street. The staff is very helpful. I do not know if we can make it a memorable trip without their help with the directions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jjcosta1961
Reviews.Content: Brought my family of 4 here in mid-May for 4 nights. I only booked 1 room, and as I know now, one typical Parisian hotel room is not enough for 4 people. We took a second room, but it was only available for the first night. By morning, Moun had found us 2 adjoining rooms in an alternate hotel just down the street called the Hotel Opera Maintenon. This was classified as a 2 star, but the rooms were clean and comfortable and even a little more spacious than the Louvre Sainte Anne. The only reason it was a 2 and not 3 star is that: 1) You must climb one flight of stairs to get to the elevator, as it only travels between the 1st floor and higher (it does not go to the ground level); and 2) It does not have air conditioning. This is not a problem in Paris in May, so we did not mind that at all. We through the windows wide open and enjoyed the cool Spring air. On the plus side, 2 rooms at the Hotel Opera Maintenon were only slightly more costly than 1 room at the Louvre Sainte Anne. It's true what is being said of the service at the Louvre Sainte Anne. Moun and Edita helped to make our first trip to Paris a tremendous success. BTW, I could not find the Hotel Opera Maintenon listed in TripAdvisor or I would post my comments there as well...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GillSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris and I spent ages looking for a hotel. Whilst browsing several websites the Louvre Sainte Anne kept appearing. After looking at reviews on this website I decided to go for it and was so glad I did. The hotel is in an excellent location for all the major attractions and public transport. Although the room was small (apparently quite common in Paris) it was spotlessly clean and serviced everyday. The bathroom had a bath with shower and constant hot water, also all toiletries provided. The breakfast is excellent value for money with a vast choice of cereals, fruit, meat, cheese, yoghurt and the usual hot dishes as well as juices, tea, coffee, milk etc. As mentioned in previous reviews the staff were brilliant, they couldn't do enough to help and always had a friendly greeting. During our stay we asked if they could recommend a restaurant and they suggested the Le Bistro de la B near Notre Dame. The food and service was excellent, fine dining at its best. Also because the hotel was promoting their bistro they paid for a taxi one way. Our only regret was that we didn't ask for a recommendation at the beginning of our holiday as I think we would have spent every evening at this bistro. I would definately recommend this hotel and would stay there again should I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cosy hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheBorg7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Louvre Sainte-Anne for 5 nights. We had a very enjoyable stay. Great location, less than 10 minute walk to the Louvre, Opera, Palais Royal, Tuileries gardens. Very clean, deserves its 3 star rating. Rooms were a little small but that did not bother us at all. Comfortable bed, air-conditioning, flat panel TV, mini-fridge, heated towel racks, hair-dryer, in-room safe. Wonderful front-desk staff especially Moun who really goes out of her way to make her guests feel welcome. Lots of Japanese restaurants around as others have pointed out but walk a couple of blocks to Avenue de L'Opera and you have French brasseries, patisseries and restaurants. Monoprix department store also a couple of blocks away if you feel like buying your own groceries. Close to Pyramides metro. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Helen711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne for six nights. Our room and bathroom were nice sized and quiet, even though the room faced the street. The room was spotless and the bed was comfortable. There was also a dressing table and mirror in the room. The biggest asset of this hotel is a nine-year employee at the front desk: Moen (pronounced Moon). She is cheerful, knowledgeable and helpful. We don't read French and misunderstood the sign on the back of the door. Our room was 145 euros/night. The rest of the sign said breakfast was 12 euros (we got that right!) and what we thought was coffee, which we thought was gratis, actually was the in-room safe! You have to run your credit card through the slot for identification, but there's no charge. We discovered that the coffee was 3 euros, but that was cheaper than anywhere else, which was 4-5 euros/cup. We thought we were being so clever to go to a restaurant to have breakfast because we thought 24 euros for breakfast was too expensive. We ended up paying over 40 euros because the coffee was so expensive and we each had two cups! As Moen would tell you, if you want to go to the Louvre, turn left out the front door, walk four blocks and you're standing in front of it. Bakery with wonderful fresh goods and a great, big cup of coffee? Left out the front door and walk one block, same side of the street. Grocery store: Out the front door, turn right and immediately turn right again to go down the side street, walk one block and there's a market kitty-corner across the street. The metro is three blocks away. You will discover that there are dozens of Japanese restaurants in that part of town. We also discovered a newly opened Persian restaurant, just 1 1/2 blocks from the hotel. Out the door, turn right. Same side of the street. They do not have hotel shuttle service to and from the airport, so be sure to book transportation the day before you're ready to leave the hotel. We're glad we did. We wanted to leave at 10:30 am. Moen called 5 or 6 services for us and there were none available at that time. She found a ride for us at 9:00 am which we immediately booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice help, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: novice27
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the hotel in early May, 2007. Great location to get around -- we did a lot of walking to places like the Tuileries garden, the Louvre, Opera, and numerous other places along the river. We also walked to some great restaurants, thanks to the help of Moun and the rest of the staff. The room was small (as expected) but clean and quite adequate. It was very quiet -- we had no night time noises to botther us, either from inside or out. We ignored all the Japanese restaurants around there and checked out many of the great French restaurants not too far away. Strongly recommend the place -- we'll use it again, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: fjblake
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend and the hotel was ideal for walking to all of central Paris and Montmartre. Also very convenient for walking to the Roissy bus going to/from CDG airport. The staff were all really friendly and the breakfast very good. Ideal for a central and non-fussy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: IT-Expert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 19-25, 2007. It is well-located – an easy 5-minute walk to the Louvre, shopping (like the MonoPrix), and many restaurants. We had a room on the top floor with a balcony that has a view of Sacre Cour. The room was adequately sized for my family – my wife and I plus our 10-year old son. Keep in mind this is Paris, and equivalent rooms are smaller than what is typically found in North America. The bathroom was newish, which would explain why it is quite large and beautiful. The bathroom has a heated towel rack (something I wish our house had). From an American viewpoint, the room would probably rate 2 ½ stars, not 3. But this is typical of hotels in Europe. I don’t know how Paris rates hotels (the number of stars is posted outside the hotel). We visited 2 four-star hotels just to check them out, and those hotels had a big difference in luxury (and price too). The hotel TV channels had 3 or 4 english channels, including the English version of EuroSport. Perhaps the best part of this hotel is the front desk staff. Mon, Amina, and the rest of the reception staff were hugely helpful and informative. From restaurant recommendations, directions, etc., they were always spot on and could all easily converse in English. We hadn’t been to Paris in decades so this was greatly appreciated. My wife was to fly out 2 days before us, but a Northeaster caused a 2-day delay in her getting to Paris, and the hotel did not charge us for those nights – what great service! Other reviews have mentioned that the hotel is in the midst of many Japanese restaurants. We tried a few out. As a former owner of 2 Japanese restaurants myself, I can tell you that the restaurants in this area are hit-or-miss. You cannot go by the crowd waiting to get in, or the ethnicity of the owners (most are not Japanese owned, but that doesn’t always matter). There is an excellent and cheap brasserie half-a-block from the hotel, right on a corner. We had breakfast at that brasserie each day – great service, great location and windows for people watching (in Paris, people watching is part of the culture). The hotel’s breakfast room (in the basement) was recently redone and looks very nice, but, we did not have breakfast in the hotel. So considering the price, the wonderful reception staff, and location, I rate our stay as 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Artemis-Angel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location only a short walk from the Louvre and the Opera House. The staff in the hotel spoke excellent English and were very helpful and friendly, The room was tastefully decorated and furnished and very clean. The bathroom was in excellent condition and had a bath. The room I had (24) was quiet even though it was next to the lift. The room has a mini bar which is always useful. I would definitely use this hotel again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sainte Anne”
Reviews.Author: Chris12Norwich
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at Sainte Anne, room small but perfect for our needs ( bed and breakfast ). Lovely clean bathroom, friendly english speaking staff, good breakfast. Good central position, no complaints, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night of February 10, 2007, and couldn't have been happier. Other reviewers were absolutely right--Berni at the front desk makes the stay so enjoyable. She was always smiling, and answered all of our questions thoroughly. The room was very clean, small (but it's Paris!), but adequate for a night or two. The hotel is only half a block from Opera street, where there is great shopping, and 2 stops for L'Open Tour bus for touring Paris. Berni had tickets for the tour, and told us how to get to the stop. There are also several Japanese restaurants right across the street from the hotel, which we loved. And there's a Starbucks within a five minute walk. On Sunday morning we weren't too successful finding a place to have breakfast, as a lot of restaurants were closed, so we opted to have the buffet breakfast from the hotel brought to our room (the breakfast room is closed for renovation). It was excellent--eggs, bacon, breads, cheese, yogurt, orange juice--all for 12 euros each. We stayed at the Westin for the 2 nights prior, due to my husband's work conference, and we were way happier with the location and service of this hotel. It's our new hotel when staying in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you like Japanese food”
Reviews.Author: linasimp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week and a half in August. Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne is in a great location. Especially if you like japanese food. I'm Japanese, and after spending a couple months I was really starting to miss Japanese food, so I was happy to be staying here. The whole street is lined with Japanese restaurants. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are VERY small and not very comfortable, but it was very clean. I would say that this hotel is just okay but the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great package”
Reviews.Author: NickTobs
Reviews.Content: I went on the strength of reviews here and was happy that I did - it is true that Moun is great and the hotel good. The area is very convenient and the road reasonably quiet. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The hotel lacks public areas but the help we received from reception, from guidance to offers of umbrellas was refreshing in a big city. We had breakfast in a cafe a few metres away and a Japanese meal opposite, both were fine. Access to the metro is another plus and the Louvre is very close. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for visiting Paris.”
Reviews.Author: bennettluke
Reviews.Content: Great value and excellent choice. My wife and i had the 5th floor room with the balcony for 9 nights around new years and were vey happy with the arrangements. Moun (The pretty Tunisian working the front desk was INCREDIBLE!). Not that the other employees were not great, they all were, but she was quite a resource. She would not hesitate to help with anything, made many excellent dining suggestions, was a great translator, called places to check reservations, i could go on but the fact is a person like her in a hotel is an invaluable resource!! Our room was fine size-wise, had a small balcony with a table and chairs and had a great view of Sacre Couer.The room also had a mini-bar that was filled daily and encouraged to be emptied and filled with whatever you want. (items were three euros a peice, the same you would pay in a cafe for a beer or coke. We were 2 blocks from the Pyramides metro and easy walk to the louvre. the breakfast was good with cafe au lait and eggs, bread and cheeses and croissants and while a little more than grabbing something at the bakery it was quicker than a cafe stop which is never under 30 minutes and like priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: UCTraveler
Reviews.Content: Chose the St Anne based on the excellent reviews and it lived up to its reputation. My friends and I reserved the triple on the top floor and were not disappointed. It was simply decorated but a decent size for Paris. We also had the balcony which made the room. What a beautiful view of Sacre Coeur. Our bathroom was quite large and was great once adjusting to no curtain and the hand held shower. As indicated by most people Moun was awesome. When my friend hurt her ankle, Moun came to the rescue. She was so friendly and made you feel comfortable right away. The hotel would not be the same without her. The rest of the staff was great as well. The convenience of the hotel was great as well. Close to the Louvre, the metro, the Opera, etc. It was also great to be so close to the Mono Prix for snacks and water (this was much cheaper than the minibar). I would definitely recommend the St. Anne!

Reviews.Title: “Love that Front Desk Lady!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotdocs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. The rooms are ok. The bathrooms...well...they're bathrooms. BUT, the lady at the front desk is AWESOME!!! She makes this hotel! She didn't even ask our names, but she already knew who we were. She was excited to hear that this was our first time in Paris and made sure that we knew the best places to go and eat. She went out of her way to draw us maps and call the restaurants and taxis to make our reservations. Too good to be true? Yeah...maybe...but you'll just have to stay there to find out for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad (More Bad)”
Reviews.Author: davidf37
Reviews.Content: Good - Moun. She is the woman working the front desk and is absolutely amazing. Anything you need help with, she'll be ther for you and she ischock full of recommendations. Just a fabolous person and wonderfully friendly More Good - Great location. Convenient to the Metro and a stone's throw from the Louvre. Be sure to check out the awesome Japanese restaurants around the hotel. They get jam packed with locals and for good reason. Cheap, excellent food. Bad - I had human hair on my comforter the 1st night and immediately got it replaced. The 2nd comforter had less hair than the first but had hair nonetheless. Staying in a hotel at this price I expected small and maybe not the sexiest decor. But the hair thing completely turned me off. Add that to the towels that had stainson them and it was absolutely impossible for me to feel fully comfortable. I tried my best to stay out of the hotel and running around the city for as long as possible as I could not bear being in a room where I kept discovering hair of various textures and colors that belonged neither to me or my wife. My aplogies to anyone who works at the Louvre Sainte Anne who reads this review as the front desk staff was awesome but housekeeping is definetely dropping the ball here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for Paris”
Reviews.Author: BobMc
Reviews.Content: First the good things. The price was good , the staff excellent and the location spot on. Now the bad things. Paris hotels under 4 star really are uncomfortable with no real public rooms no easy chairs in the bedroom no restaraunt and the usual drab decor. This property was no worse than other hotels in this class. I found the staff friendly and helpful. Paris just seems to be getting left behind with their modest hotels not keeping up with world standards. I would recomend spending the exta money for a more comfortable hotel but on a budget the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: gomez_addams
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel largely on the basis of the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, and we were happy we did. The only con is that our room was smaller than we are used to in the USA. The beds were very comfortable and the A/C worked great. I would not want to spend much time in that room - really it is only for sleeping, getting dressed, etc. But we were not in Paris to watch CNN. I can't say enough about the staff. I mention Moun in particular, since she was the one who gave us a tremendous welcome to Paris. However, the rest of the staff were equally friendly and most helpful. All the staff spoke English. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was tremendous - allowing us to walk to most places, or hop on a nearby bus line. We did not experience any outside noise in our room. We didn't try the brunch they offer. I have read people bemoaning the lack of a shower curtain. The tub/shower has a small glass partition covering the front third of the tub. To avoid getting water on the floor, simply stand at the front of the tub, and turn around in such a way that you are facing the glass wall. It also helps if you don't turn the water on full blast. By doing this, we had a good shower in the usual amount of time, and no water on the floor. Bottom line: GREAT staff (best I've ever encountered), great location. great value, and fully adequate room.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Louvre Sainte Anne
HotelInfo.Address: 32, rue Sainte Anne | 1st Arr., 75001 Paris, France
